Introduction to the job
The EUV Source team in San Diego operates in a fast-paced, uniquely innovative, and challenging environment to deliver new-to-industry products supporting the commercialization of EUV technology by ASML. The Senior Machine Learning Engineer will be part of the EUV Droplet Generator Controls team within ASML San Diego. The Droplet Generator is sometimes referred to as the “heart” of the EUV source and supplies the tin which fuels EUV generation. This requires control and optimization where we produces tin droplets 27um in diameter, over 100 m/s in speed and position them with um and ns accuracies.
Role and responsibilities
Due to high complexity of the EUV light source, we, as Source Performance, are a dedicated team with the mission to validate and ensure that EUV sources meet or exceed customer performance requirements and expectations. In order to execute this mission, EUV Source Performance acts as the critical enabler of knowledge acquisition and transfer throughout the products development process, via:
Substantive participation in the technology development and system definition process for products in definition and early development stage.
Ensuring quality of the module to sub-system to system-level performance testing and validation for the products in integration phase.
Driving technology improvements enabling new products field release and refinement of system specifications based upon deep understanding of factory and field performance.
The creation and delivery of analytic tooling, action plans and procedures to drive maximum solving power of our customer support organizations for sustaining products.
Collaborate to design and implement end-to-end AI and data science lifecycle, from data collection and preprocessing to model deployment and monitoring, providing technical leadership and guidance.
Apply theoretical models, concepts, methods, and novel experimental techniques to quantitatively interpret performance of EUV source systems across a wide range of issues and multiple technical disciplines.
Produce clear, concise technical documentation in defined company formats, present results and align with cross-functional teams.
Work closely with and cross-functional groups (systems engineering, development engineering, scientists, IT, global customer support personnel, manufacturing personnel) to drive results in AI projects.
Education and experience
MS or PhD in Computer Science, Data Science, or Machine Learning.
Minimum 5 years’ experience in a similar role.
Perform verification of SDS, verify design specifications from team members and contribute to the testing process (TPS, a-test, (sub system) TAR, b-test).
Integrate sub-systems into the system, execute configuration management, and provide support to projects.
Structural trouble shooting capabilities on functional level and manages many technical uncertainties at sub-module level and develops creative solutions to solve uncertainties.
Skills
The ideal candidate will have experience in designing and implementing machine learning and deep learning architectures. This includes:
Developing and optimizing neural network architectures using frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch.
Implementing scalable machine learning models and algorithms in a cloud-based environment.
Experience with Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, and other AI domains.
Proficiency in using GPU and TPU hardware accelerators for deep learning training and inference.
Understanding of the concept of large complex system integration and practices.
Excellent analytical and troubleshooting skills.
Excellent inter-personal and customer service skills, with an advanced understanding of customer relationship building.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to reduce large amounts of data, create a concise summary, and effectively report results through written and/or graphical formats.
Ability to define and execute tasks based on project descriptions with minimum or no supervision.
Other information
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
While performing the duties of this job, the employee routinely is required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch.
The employee is occasionally required to move around the campus.
The employee may occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds.
May require travel dependent on business needs.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Can work under deadlines.
The environment generally is moderate in temperature and noise level.
Must be able to wear disposable rubber gloves for entire duration of shift.
Wearing of eye protection in manufacturing areas is required.
Must be able to read and interpret data, information, and documents.
Can observe and respond to people and situations and interact with others encountered in the course of work.
Can learn and apply new information or skills.

At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.
Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.
Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.
We are looking for a Systems Software Engineer to join our team to qualify and automate testing of new hardware technologies, as well as uplevel our traditional qualifications efforts. This person will collaborate with internal eBay teams working on cloud and storage platforms, key technology and systems integration vendors, open source software communities, and with other members of the hardware engineering team.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
You will work as part of the Hardware Engineering team to reduce the cost of purchasing and operating eBay’s fleet of servers, saving millions of dollars a year.
You will translate internal customer requests into requirements, and develop benchmarks and test suites to ensure our platforms meet their needs.
Evaluate the performance and reliability of new hardware platforms and hardware components using automated tests, with a strong emphasis on working with our cloud, provisioning, and storage partners.
Expand and maintain our automation that we use daily for testing, and reliability work.
Develop performance test plans and experiments with our customer teams to ensure we are able to use our hardware to the fullest of its ability.
Work with our customers to debug, and address any reliability or performance issues they have with our server products.
Identify and suggest the ideal OS and BIOS settings for our systems.
Explore and propose new hardware/software technologies that improve performance, or reduce cost of our products.
You will improve our monitoring and data collection tooling, to ensure we’re recording relevant information.

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
You have at least 5-8 years of systems engineering experience using Linux as an operating system.
You should understand how to configure servers, and work with a standard toolset to automate testing.
You should be able to explain how linux uses various hardware components, and what tunables it provides.
We primarily use Python and Bash for automating tasks, you must be proficient in one of these languages.
You should have experience with kubernetes, and its concepts.
You should have used a revision control system like GIT, and be familiar with concepts like branching and merging.
You must bea able to build and use containers using Docker or another technology.
We’d like you to be familiar with extending a monitoring framework like Prometheus, so we can collect additional data from our testing.
We’d like for you to be familiar with Kubernetes and cloud computing concepts.
It would be a bonus if you’ve used various profiling and performance tools like perf, vtune, or performance co-pilot.
You should understand how to compile and build source code, especially the linux kernel.
It would be phenomenal if you have experience analyzing logs, and working with data repositories to help drive technical decisions.
It would be a bonus if you’ve deployed and configured systems at scale using standard technology like PXE, Ansible, Salt, and Puppet.
You must be able to communicate ideas clearly when speaking or writing.
BS or equivalent experience EE or CS with continued formal or informal education
Position ideally based in San Jose, CA with minimal travel required.
The pay range for this position at commencement of employment in California, Washington, or New York is expected in the range below.
$149,200 - $234,850

Quantum-Systems Inc is a global leader in aerial intelligence and autonomous, AI-powered aerial robotics. We design, develop, manufacture and deliver eVTOL Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) and an ecosystem of related products and services. Our business directly addresses the Defense and Security markets in North America, Asia Pacific and Latin America. We currently have an opening for a well-qualified candidate to join our Engineering Staff. This position reports to the Director of Engineering.
Description:
As a Software Engineer at Quantum-Systems you will play a critical role in solving challenges within the dynamic and competitive government UAS industry. In this role, you will be a creative problem solver, tackling the multi-faceted problems facing our various platforms and delivering cutting edge technology transforming the battlespace. Candidates will exemplify their technical acumen to identify, create and advance new technologies aligned to our company's vision for UAS and Airborne Artificial Intelligence. From envisioning future warfighter needs to executing advanced platform technologies you will be at the forefront of Aerial Intelligence.
Responsibilities:
The Software Engineer is responsible for the following:
Collaborate as part of the Quantum-Systems engineering team
Able to lead team of to deliver project milestones in a high tempo work environment
Minimal Supervision to implement high level software architectures
Resolve complex problems during troubleshooting using industry best practices
Integrate unmanned system technologies such as edge computed data fusion, vision AI, teaming and payload coordination
Lead technical software integration efforts
Decompose the scope of an assigned project, develop corresponding software architectures and software design
Develop and Execute Software Integration and Test Plans
Lead subsystem and low-level technical reviews
Position requires travel up to 10% of the time to support business needs
Embody, promote, and live the Quantum Systems core principles
Experience:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor of Science (BS) in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline and 2-7 years of Embedded Software experience; OR Ph.D in a STEM discipline and 2+ years of Embedded Software experience,
U.S Citizenship.
2+ years Experience in Embedded Linux design
Capable of working both independently and in a team environment
Experience in Video and Data Communications across Ethernet
Demonstrated experience in embedded C++, C#
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
This is an Onsite position
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years of machine learning development
Demonstrated Experience in Windows WPF development
Embedded communication networks using UDP streams and sockets
Demonstrated ability to integrate and test complex systems including Datalinks, Control systems and vehicles
Success in a startup environment demonstrating adaptability
Experience with Unmanned Aircraft development experience a plus
Ability to prioritize and adjust tasks to accomplish desired results
Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and/or accomplishing them simultaneously
Ability to comprehend and analyze complex problems and develop solutions
Background Check/U.S. Citizenship required
We are hiring different Software engineer levels focusing on an Aerospace background. Salary will be based on experience.

Join our team to work in an embedded technology environment to develop software working with real time operating systems for use in flight and mission critical systems. We build complex aircraft systems using the latest technologies including simulation, cloud computing, DevSecOps, and cyber that can rapidly evolve to deliver enhanced capabilities for fielded systems, modernizing in partnership with our customers to meet their most complex missions. Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems has an opening for a Sr Principal Simulation Software Engineer to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals within our Software organization in Palmdale, California, where we define possible.

Accomplish
In this role you will design, develop, integrate and test software for our end-user customers and businesses. Specifically, you will be responsible for the design, architecture, application development, and flight simulation. You will work with multi-disciplinary teams, such as with Systems Engineering, Cloud & Application, Test Automation, DevSecOps and Systems Test, in an Agile software development environment. Our simulation software is critical to the current and future company projects. You will analyze system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls.
Essential Functions:
Work in an innovative environment, on significantly diverse assignments, and in collaborative team settings across all levels
Participate in the full software development life cycle including requirements, design, implementation, qualification, and delivery of software products to our customers
Architect and develop applications in a simulated training environment
Be a part of Agile Scrum teams to develop software products for multiple software baselines
Succeed
The individual we seek will be self-motivated, proactive, goal-oriented to help us grow our services, become even better at what we do and will possess the following qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a STEM discipline (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) with 9 years of related engineering experience; OR a Master’s degree in STEM with 7 years of related engineering experience
Experience with the full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) - software design requirements, application development, integration, testing, and deployment
Experience with at least one of the following programming or scripting languages: C, C++, and Python
Experience with two or more of the following tools: Jira, Crucible, Bitbucket, Subversion, Bamboo, Jenkins, Sonarqube, Fortify, or Coverity
Must have an active DoD Secret or higher clearance.
Must have the ability to obtain and maintain Special Access Program (SAP) clearance prior to the commencement of employment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong understanding of C and C++ languages including templates, memory storage, and compiler/linker
Experience with or knowledge of Joint Simulation Environment (JSE), Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS), or High-Level Architecture (HLA)
Experience with Full-Motion Flight Training Systems
Experience with simulated threat environments such as AFSIM or NGTS
Ability to collaborate with systems engineers, hardware designers and integration/test engineers to develop and maintain complex software systems
Excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interface with all levels of employees and management

Thrive with Us

At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.
Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.
Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.
We are looking for a Systems Software Engineer to join our team to qualify and automate testing of new hardware technologies, as well as uplevel our traditional qualifications efforts. This person will collaborate with internal eBay teams working on cloud and storage platforms, key technology and systems integration vendors, open source software communities, and with other members of the hardware engineering team.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
You will work as part of the Hardware Engineering team to reduce the cost of purchasing and operating eBay’s fleet of servers, saving millions of dollars a year.
You will translate internal customer requests into requirements, and develop benchmarks and test suites to ensure our platforms meet their needs.
Evaluate the performance and reliability of new hardware platforms and hardware components using automated tests, with a strong emphasis on working with our cloud, provisioning, and storage partners.
Expand and maintain our automation that we use daily for testing, and reliability work.
Develop performance test plans and experiments with our customer teams to ensure we are able to use our hardware to the fullest of its ability.
Work with our customers to debug, and address any reliability or performance issues they have with our server products.
Identify and suggest the ideal OS and BIOS settings for our systems.
Explore and propose new hardware/software technologies that improve performance, or reduce cost of our products.
You will improve our monitoring and data collection tooling, to ensure we’re recording relevant information.

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
You have at least 5-8 years of systems engineering experience using Linux as an operating system.
You should understand how to configure servers, and work with a standard toolset to automate testing.
You should be able to explain how linux uses various hardware components, and what tunables it provides.
We primarily use Python and Bash for automating tasks, you must be proficient in one of these languages.
You should have experience with kubernetes, and its concepts.
You should have used a revision control system like GIT, and be familiar with concepts like branching and merging.
You must bea able to build and use containers using Docker or another technology.
We’d like you to be familiar with extending a monitoring framework like Prometheus, so we can collect additional data from our testing.
We’d like for you to be familiar with Kubernetes and cloud computing concepts.
It would be a bonus if you’ve used various profiling and performance tools like perf, vtune, or performance co-pilot.
You should understand how to compile and build source code, especially the linux kernel.
It would be phenomenal if you have experience analyzing logs, and working with data repositories to help drive technical decisions.
It would be a bonus if you’ve deployed and configured systems at scale using standard technology like PXE, Ansible, Salt, and Puppet.
You must be able to communicate ideas clearly when speaking or writing.
BS or equivalent experience EE or CS with continued formal or informal education

At STAr-Edge, you will be part of a skilled R&D team that designs precision testing instruments for semiconductor manufacturers all over the world. We are seeking software engineers who have the skill set to write low level C++ hardware driver code, and have the skillset to architect system frameworks in C#.
As a member of a small research team, you and everyone on the team is expected to be skilled in multiple engineering disciplines. Specific responsibilities for this position are to code instrument drivers, define system architecture, write software requirement documents, and manage small remote software teams.
Qualifications:
BSCS or BSEE required.
3+ years of management experience with 10+ years of the overall experience
Critical Competencies:
o Expertise in C++ and C#
o Low level hardware driver experience
o Experience with multi-process communication.
o Experience with real-time performance optimization
o Electrical engineering experience is a plus
o Proficiency in the Chinese language is a plus
Company Description
STAr-Edge Technologies, Inc. is headquartered in Carlsbad, CA. We design and manufacture high precision test instruments used in the manufacturing and qualification of the semiconductors. Our major customers include top tier players in the semiconductor industries such as tsmc, UMC, Global Foundries, Samsung, Toshiba, Renesas, Maxim, and OmniVision.
STAr-Edge Technologies is the USA branch of STAr Technologies, which is an international company with over 600 employees worldwide. STAr is the acronym for "Semiconductor Test Architects" - we are the architects with leading technologies for semiconductor test solutions.

Bachelor's degree in computer science or a related field.
2+ years of experience in front-end development using React.
Strong proficiency in React, NodeJS, HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
Understanding of responsive design and cross-browser compatibility.

Strong problem-solving and debugging skills.

C# and .NET development experience.

At Northrop Grumman you will have a challenging and rewarding opportunity to be a part of our Enterprise-wide digital transformation. Our success is grounded in our ability to embrace change, move quickly and continuously drive innovation. The Software team at Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is looking for you to join our team as a Sr Principal Software Engineer - Database Administrator based out of Pt Mugu, CA near our Camarillo, CA site. Come work with us near the beach with a growing diverse team!
If you are an experienced Database Administrator or have Software Development experience with the ability to design, develop and administer complex databases using tools such as SQL, WE WANT YOU!
What you will get to do:
Work as a self-starter, work with minimal direct supervision.
Work in an Agile environment.
Implements and maintains smooth operation of databases.
Conducts performance tuning of indexes and databases.
Reviews database design and integration of systems, provides backup recovery and makes recommendations regarding enhancements and/or improvements.
Formulates policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management.
Able to work collaboratively in a team environment with other highly motivated system/network administrators, software developers, and mission planners.
What We Can Offer You:
Northrop Grumman provides a comprehensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages your growth and supports the mutual success of our people and our company. Northrop Grumman benefits give you the flexibility and control to choose the benefits that make the most sense for you and your family. Your benefits will include the following:
Health Plan
Savings Plan
Paid Time Off
Additional benefits
Education Assistance
Training and Development
9/80 Schedule
This position is contingent upon customer approval
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree with 9+ years of relative experience; OR Master’s Degree with 7+ years of relative experience or in lieu of a degree, an additional 4+ years of experience is required.
Proficiency in systems and database management
The ability to design, develop, and administer complex databases using a database language such as SQL OR similar database languages to SQL.
Familiarity with database management best practices.
Experience implementing database schema architectures such as the coding and design of stored procedures, foreign keys, table relationships, etc.
Proficiency with Microsoft SQL Server and PostgreSQL
Strong verbal communication and customer service skills in a teamwork environment
US Citizenship and must have Interim Secret clearance prior to starting. Once started, must have the ability to obtain and maintain Secret clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working in a containerized environment with Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate within the NGC various sites as well as with customers.
Experience with high level coding languages such as C#, C++, PowerShell, VBA, etc.
Experience with Azure DevOps / TFS and Git

At eBay, we're more than a global ecommerce leader — we’re changing the way the world shops and sells. Our platform empowers millions of buyers and sellers in more than 190 markets around the world. We’re committed to pushing boundaries and leaving our mark as we reinvent the future of ecommerce for enthusiasts.
Our customers are our compass, authenticity thrives, bold ideas are welcome, and everyone can bring their unique selves to work — every day. We're in this together, sustaining the future of our customers, our company, and our planet.
Join a team of passionate thinkers, innovators, and dreamers — and help us connect people and build communities to create economic opportunity for all.
We are looking for a Systems Software Engineer to join our team to qualify and automate testing of new hardware technologies, as well as uplevel our traditional qualifications efforts. This person will collaborate with internal eBay teams working on cloud and storage platforms, key technology and systems integration vendors, open source software communities, and with other members of the hardware engineering team.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
You will work as part of the Hardware Engineering team to reduce the cost of purchasing and operating eBay’s fleet of servers, saving millions of dollars a year.
You will translate internal customer requests into requirements, and develop benchmarks and test suites to ensure our platforms meet their needs.
Evaluate the performance and reliability of new hardware platforms and hardware components using automated tests, with a strong emphasis on working with our cloud, provisioning, and storage partners.
Expand and maintain our automation that we use daily for testing, and reliability work.
Develop performance test plans and experiments with our customer teams to ensure we are able to use our hardware to the fullest of its ability.
Work with our customers to debug, and address any reliability or performance issues they have with our server products.
Identify and suggest the ideal OS and BIOS settings for our systems.
Explore and propose new hardware/software technologies that improve performance, or reduce cost of our products.
You will improve our monitoring and data collection tooling, to ensure we’re recording relevant information.

DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
You have at least 5-8 years of systems engineering experience using Linux as an operating system.
You should understand how to configure servers, and work with a standard toolset to automate testing.
You should be able to explain how linux uses various hardware components, and what tunables it provides.
We primarily use Python and Bash for automating tasks, you must be proficient in one of these languages.
You should have experience with kubernetes, and its concepts.
You should have used a revision control system like GIT, and be familiar with concepts like branching and merging.
You must bea able to build and use containers using Docker or another technology.
We’d like you to be familiar with extending a monitoring framework like Prometheus, so we can collect additional data from our testing.
We’d like for you to be familiar with Kubernetes and cloud computing concepts.
It would be a bonus if you’ve used various profiling and performance tools like perf, vtune, or performance co-pilot.
You should understand how to compile and build source code, especially the linux kernel.
It would be phenomenal if you have experience analyzing logs, and working with data repositories to help drive technical decisions.
It would be a bonus if you’ve deployed and configured systems at scale using standard technology like PXE, Ansible, Salt, and Puppet.
You must be able to communicate ideas clearly when speaking or writing.
BS or equivalent experience EE or CS with continued formal or informal education
Position ideally based in San Jose, CA with minimal travel required.
The pay range for this position at commencement of employment in California, Washington, or New York is expected in the range below.
$149,200 - $234,850
Base pay offered may vary depending on multiple individualized factors, including location, skills, and experience. The total compensation package for this position may also include other elements, including a target bonus and restricted stock units (as applicable) in addition to a full range of medical, financial, and/or other benefits (including 401(k) eligibility and various paid time off benefits, such as PTO and parental leave). Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.
If hired, employees will be in an “at-will position” and the Company reserves the right to modify base salary (as well as any other discretionary payment or compensation program) at any time, including for reasons related to individual performance, Company or individual department/team performance, and market factors.

Quantum-Systems Inc is a global leader in aerial intelligence and autonomous, AI-powered aerial robotics. We design, develop, manufacture and deliver eVTOL Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) and an ecosystem of related products and services. Our business directly addresses the Defense and Security markets in North America, Asia Pacific and Latin America. We currently have an opening for a well-qualified candidate to join our Engineering Staff. This position reports to the Director of Engineering.
Description:
As a Software Engineer at Quantum-Systems you will play a critical role in solving challenges within the dynamic and competitive government UAS industry. In this role, you will be a creative problem solver, tackling the multi-faceted problems facing our various platforms and delivering cutting edge technology transforming the battlespace. Candidates will exemplify their technical acumen to identify, create and advance new technologies aligned to our company's vision for UAS and Airborne Artificial Intelligence. From envisioning future warfighter needs to executing advanced platform technologies you will be at the forefront of Aerial Intelligence.

The Software Engineer is responsible for the following:
Collaborate as part of the Quantum-Systems engineering team
Able to lead team of to deliver project milestones in a high tempo work environment
Minimal Supervision to implement high level software architectures
Resolve complex problems during troubleshooting using industry best practices
Integrate unmanned system technologies such as edge computed data fusion, vision AI, teaming and payload coordination
Lead technical software integration efforts
Decompose the scope of an assigned project, develop corresponding software architectures and software design
Develop and Execute Software Integration and Test Plans
Lead subsystem and low-level technical reviews
Position requires travel up to 10% of the time to support business needs
Embody, promote, and live the Quantum Systems core principles
Experience:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor of Science (BS) in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline and 2-7 years of Embedded Software experience; OR Ph.D in a STEM discipline and 2+ years of Embedded Software experience,
U.S Citizenship.
2+ years Experience in Embedded Linux design
Capable of working both independently and in a team environment
Experience in Video and Data Communications across Ethernet
Demonstrated experience in embedded C++, C#
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
This is an Onsite position
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years of machine learning development
Demonstrated Experience in Windows WPF development
Embedded communication networks using UDP streams and sockets
Demonstrated ability to integrate and test complex systems including Datalinks, Control systems and vehicles
Success in a startup environment demonstrating adaptability
Experience with Unmanned Aircraft development experience a plus
Ability to prioritize and adjust tasks to accomplish desired results
Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and/or accomplishing them simultaneously
Ability to comprehend and analyze complex problems and develop solutions
Background Check/U.S. Citizenship required

Job Title: Principal Software Engineer, ADAS Compute Platform
Job details:
Job Description
If you are a Principal S oftware E ngineer with a passion for creating high-performance, fault-tolerant systems and have experience in leading complex software projects, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the future of automated driving technology!
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Principal Software Engineer to lead the design and development of the operating system (OS) for our autonomy subsystem, including levels L1, L2, L3, and L4. This OS encompasses a traditional OS Kernel and a critical middleware layer responsible for coordinating complex activities between various services . Your role will involve designing and implementing high-performance, reliable, and fault-tolerant systems essential for automated driving.
Key Responsibilities:
Architectural Leadership: Design and oversee the development of the middleware layer that integrates with the OS and AI/ML applications. Focus on high performance, reliability, and fault tolerance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Engage with key stakeholders including Automated Driving teams, Safety team, Systems Engineering, and the Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) team to ensure cohesive and effective system integration.
Innovation and Strategy: Drive innovation in new methods and initiatives, especially in areas with undefined procedures. Develop and communicate strategic visions specific to your responsibilities.
Prototype Development: Build prototypes and contribute to the implementation phase as needed. Leverage modern software engineering practices to ensure robust and scalable solutions.
Mentorship and Guidance: Provide technical leadership and mentorship to engineering teams. Help remove roadblocks and resolve potential issues to maintain project momentum.
Technical Influence: Shape the technical strategies and approaches of partner teams to align with overall project goals.
Technical Responsibilities:
Middleware Architecture: Lead the architectural design and implementation of the middleware layer that supports interactions between the OS and AI/ML applications.
Performance and Reliability: Ensure that the systems are built for high performance, reliability, and fault tolerance, leveraging extensive experience in these areas.
Hands-On Development: Maintain strong C++ coding skills and hands-on involvement in software development. Experience in embedded development is preferred but not mandatory.
Qualifications:
Experience: Significant experience in software architecture and development, with a focus on high-performance and fault-tolerant systems. Experience in building and managing complex middleware layers is highly desirable.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in C++ is essential. Experience with embedded systems, Linux, Windows, or Mobile OS is beneficial.
Leadership: Proven ability to provide technical leadership, drive initiatives, and mentor other engineers.
Communication: Strong skills in creating and communicating strategic visions, preparing presentations, and collaborating cross-functionally.
Problem-Solving: Ability to observe , identify , and address roadblocks and issues effectively.
Additional Information:
Flexibility: Open to candidates with experience in various operating systems, including Linux, Windows, or Mobile OS, in addition to embedded systems.
This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to Mountain View three times per week, at minimum.
This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to Mountain View three times per week, at minimum.

About GM
Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.
Why Join Us
We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.
Benefits Overview
The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.
Diversity Information
General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

GM is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. As part of this commitment, all practices and decisions relating to terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment are made without regard to an individ ual's protected characteristics. For purposes of this policy, “protected characteristics" include an individual's actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, weight, height, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. WordPress Developer (Web Design & Website Management exp req) Description
Our client is seeking a WordPress Developer to join their team in Palm Springs, CA. You will be responsible for designing, managing, and optimizing multiple websites. Your goal is to ensure the sites are secure, functional, up-to-date, and visually appealing. This role blends technical expertise with creative online marketing and design, requiring a proactive individual who can collaborate effectively and work independently. Essential duties include designing and updating content, improving functionality, monitoring web traffic, SEO, and maintaining site security & stability. In addition to that, you will assist with basic IT support issues in the office as needed. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of creating user-friendly and visually appealing WordPress websites that enhance a brand’s online presence. This is an excellent opportunity to join a well-established and respected publication where you will have the opportunity to leave your mark on the future of its publications.

Manage daily website operations and maintenance
Update website content to align with current SEO trends
Design visually appealing landing pages that enhance the brand’s image
Monitor and report on website performance and traffic

Troubleshoot and resolve website issues promptly
Install and configure computer hardware/software as needed
Support digital advertising efforts and placements
Maintain security protocols and perform necessary updates
Repair any broken links and fix any reported bugs
Meet with management regularly to discuss current and future functionality
Create and maintain commercial sites as needed
Troubleshoot system and network problems

2+ years of SEO and Google Analytics experience required
Experience designing and managing robust media websites required
Experience managing large websites (thousands of posts/pages) required

Portfolio of work required

Quantum-Systems Inc is a global leader in aerial intelligence and autonomous, AI-powered aerial robotics. We design, develop, manufacture and deliver eVTOL Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) and an ecosystem of related products and services. Our business directly addresses the Defense and Security markets in North America, Asia Pacific and Latin America. We currently have an opening for a well-qualified candidate to join our Engineering Staff. This position reports to the Director of Engineering.
Description:
As a Software Engineer at Quantum-Systems you will play a critical role in solving challenges within the dynamic and competitive government UAS industry. In this role, you will be a creative problem solver, tackling the multi-faceted problems facing our various platforms and delivering cutting edge technology transforming the battlespace. Candidates will exemplify their technical acumen to identify, create and advance new technologies aligned to our company's vision for UAS and Airborne Artificial Intelligence. From envisioning future warfighter needs to executing advanced platform technologies you will be at the forefront of Aerial Intelligence.

Collaborate as part of the Quantum-Systems engineering team
Able to lead team of to deliver project milestones in a high tempo work environment
Minimal Supervision to implement high level software architectures
Resolve complex problems during troubleshooting using industry best practices
Integrate unmanned system technologies such as edge computed data fusion, vision AI, teaming and payload coordination
Lead technical software integration efforts
Decompose the scope of an assigned project, develop corresponding software architectures and software design
Develop and Execute Software Integration and Test Plans
Lead subsystem and low-level technical reviews
Position requires travel up to 10% of the time to support business needs
Embody, promote, and live the Quantum Systems core principles
Experience:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor of Science (BS) in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline and 2-7 years of Embedded Software experience; OR Ph.D in a STEM discipline and 2+ years of Embedded Software experience,
U.S Citizenship.
2+ years Experience in Embedded Linux design
Capable of working both independently and in a team environment
Experience in Video and Data Communications across Ethernet
Demonstrated experience in embedded C++, C#
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
This is an Onsite position
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years of machine learning development
Demonstrated Experience in Windows WPF development
Embedded communication networks using UDP streams and sockets
Demonstrated ability to integrate and test complex systems including Datalinks, Control systems and vehicles
Success in a startup environment demonstrating adaptability
Experience with Unmanned Aircraft development experience a plus
Ability to prioritize and adjust tasks to accomplish desired results
Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and/or accomplishing them simultaneously
Ability to comprehend and analyze complex problems and develop solutions
Background Check/U.S. Citizenship required

At STAr-Edge, you will be part of a skilled R&D team that designs precision testing instruments for semiconductor manufacturers all over the world. We are seeking software engineers who have the skill set to write low level C++ hardware driver code, and have the skillset to architect system frameworks in C#.
As a member of a small research team, you and everyone on the team is expected to be skilled in multiple engineering disciplines. Specific responsibilities for this position are to code instrument drivers, define system architecture, write software requirement documents, and manage small remote software teams.
Qualifications:
BSCS or BSEE required.
3+ years of management experience with 10+ years of the overall experience

o Expertise in C++ and C#
o Low level hardware driver experience
o Experience with multi-process communication.
o Experience with real-time performance optimization
o Electrical engineering experience is a plus
o Proficiency in the Chinese language is a plus
Company Description
STAr-Edge Technologies, Inc. is headquartered in Carlsbad, CA. We design and manufacture high precision test instruments used in the manufacturing and qualification of the semiconductors. Our major customers include top tier players in the semiconductor industries such as tsmc, UMC, Global Foundries, Samsung, Toshiba, Renesas, Maxim, and OmniVision.
STAr-Edge Technologies is the USA branch of STAr Technologies, which is an international company with over 600 employees worldwide. STAr is the acronym for "Semiconductor Test Architects" - we are the architects with leading technologies for semiconductor test solutions.

Job Title: Machine Learning Engineer - Deep Neural Networks
Job details:
Machine Learning Engineer - Deep Neural Networks
Since the Mid-90's, we've been partnering with the US government & more recently commercial entities taking a unique approach to R&D and applying that toward real-world solutions. We provide extensive expertise in Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) image processing algorithm development, computer vision, modeling and analysis of radar systems & pattern recognition technologies.

We are looking to add an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to our esteemed team who can develop cutting edge Deep Learning technologies in the domains of Computer Vision, Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR), and Geospatial Exploitation. Due to the hands-on and sensitive nature of our work, our ideal candidate will have an active Top Secret DoD Security Clearance and be willing to work out of our HQ in El Segundo, CA.
Position Overview: The Machine Learning Engineer - Deep Neural Networks will develop, train, and deploy machine learning algorithms and neural networks to solve challenging real-world problems. The engineer will work with a wide range of tools including Python, TensorFlow, pandas, NumPy, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, and open source frameworks.
Key Responsibilities:
Design, implement machine learning algorithms & deep neural networks
Perform data analysis using pandas, NumPy, and other libraries
Train & deploy ML models in cloud environments
Develop & maintain code for production-grade ML applications (Python, etc.)
Collaborate with other engineers to optimize models while improving accuracy
Create visualizations to monitor model performance
Troubleshoot & debug machine learning models
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Physics, Applied Mathematics, or a related field
1-5+ years of experience in Machine Learning (ML), Data Science, and Artificial Intelligence (AI), ideally with deep learning experience
Knowledge in Python, C/C++, TensorFlow, and Neural Networks
Ideally you've worked with most or some of the following: Computer Vision, Radar, SAR, Lidar, Matlab, Deep Neural Networks, pandas, NumPy, Keras, PyTorch, scikit-learn, and open source frameworks
Excellent debugging and problem solving skills
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills

Benefits
Competitive base pay
Retirement program -~ 15% of the employee's salary with no employee contribution required
Company-paid PPO plan
Generous PTO / vacation policy
All employees participate in company bonus plan

Job Title: AUTOMATION ENGINEER III - SENIOR AUTOMATION ENG
Job details:
LISI AEROSPACE is ranked 60th in the global aerospace value chain and specializes in the design and manufacture of high-tech metal components to enhance aircraft safety and performance. Active since 1950 in the fastener market (no. 3 worldwide), LISI AEROSPACE has been a recognized player in metal components for aircraft engines and airframes since 2011. With its dedication to industrial excellence, LISI AEROSPACE aims to become a leader in costs, quality, deadlines and workplace safety. This mindset is represented at every level of our company and by all of our team members. At LISI AEROSPACE, we focus above all on advancement and flexibility. Every employee is empowered and has the latitude they need to carry out their assignments and develop their skills. We provide this mobility and training through our Corporate University, the LISI Knowledge Institute (LKI). As a result, our company is growing fast and always welcoming new talents.

SENIOR AUTOMATION ENGINEER (AUTOMATION ENGINEER III)

SUMMARY:
The Senior Automation Engineer maximizes efficiency of aerospace fastener production by implementing new machines and processes. They must consider the ergonomics, workflow, safety, quality standards, and work force utilization to develop the most reliable and efficient processes using the latest technology.

The Senior Automation Engineer is expected to be able to lead automation projects from start to finish. The engineer is expected to have a high level of technical expertise in Robotics, electronics, PLC, integration, and mechanical design.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, develop, build, and test automation and robotic systems for new and existing equipment.
Create electrical schematics and design control panels using AutoCad Electrical.
Create solid models and detailed drawings using SolidWorks.
Enter machine drawings, electrical schematics, BOMs into machine manuals with the correct labeling as well as backed up in the correct locations.
Responsible for the design, budget preparation, planning and scheduling, procurement, installation and commissioning of capital projects
Drive automation improvements and implementation to improve Operator safety, Machine efficiency, and plant capacities.
Diagnose mechanical and/or electrical problems and determine how to correct them, checking blueprints, repair manuals, and parts catalogs as necessary.
Focuses on and documents cost reduction initiatives for design implementation, maintenance, and repair work.
Ensures systems meet safety, quality and production rate requirements.
Assists in the research, design and development of manufacturing processes including production flow, assembly methods and production equipment.
Coordinates product/process analysis for cost reduction, quality improvement, and improved efficiency.
Conduct machine PLC programming diagnose, troubleshoot and debug software programs to modify automation or robotic systems.
Conduct research on robotic technology to create new robotic systems or system capabilities.
Able to perform tool design (fixtures) with use of computer assisted design applications and programs.
Relies on experience and judgment to plan, organize, and accomplish set goals and objectives.
Collaborate with production management to analyze data and site metrics to identify opportunities for automation
Works under limited supervision with a certain degree of creativity and latitude is required.
All employees are responsible for complying with the rules and regulations set forth by Federal, Local, and State government, LISI Aerospace, and HSE Procedures.
All employees are responsible for complying with ISO 14001standards, aspects, directives and impact as related to the HSE policy commitments.
All employees are responsible for attending all training provided and for adhering to all HSE procedures, policies, and plans, conforming to reporting requirements and safe operating procedures at all times.
All employees are required to bring any known or suspected nonconformance for all company procedures or legal requirements to management’s attention immediately.
Implements and suggests waste elimination initiatives specifically related to the function and department such as EMS and recycling opportunities to elimination of production waste.
Attend all required job-related training (internal and external)
Share insight, solutions, and best practices within team and other local LISI sites
Mentor and provide technical guidance to other members of the automation team.
Ways of working, Experience, and Behaviors
To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:

Analytical- Strong technical math skills to synthesizes complex or diverse information; Collects and researches data; Uses experience to complement data; understands the workflows and procedures. Ability to calculate and set controls which regulate machining factors (tool sequencing, speed, feed, depth & angle of cut).
Technical Skills– Technical skills in manufacturing processes and methods including flow, layout, assembly and production equipment.
Oral and Written Communication- Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; listens intently to others and seeks clarification; Provides clear and pleasant responses to inquires regardless of the situation; Presents complex concepts in a simple manner to achieve understanding of benefit plans at all levels of the organization. Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings.
Team Work- Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Places success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed; Recognizes accomplishments of team members.
Business Acumen- Understands business implications of decisions; Displays orientation to profitability; Aligns work with strategic goals.
Cost Consciousness- Works within approved budget; Develops and implements cost saving measures; Contributes to profits and revenue; Conserves organizational resources.
Adaptability- Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.
Planning/Organizing- Independently capable to prioritizes and plans work activities of self and others; Uses time efficiently; Plans for resources in a creative way only adding cost as absolutely necessary; Sets goals and objectives; Organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; Develops realistic individual action plans.
Professionalism- Approaches others in a tactful manner; Reacts well under pressure; Treats others with respect and consideration regardless of their status or position; Accepts responsibility for own actions; Follows through on commitments.
ESSENTIAL JOB REQUIREMENTS SKILLS AND ABILITIES
Education and/or Experience
B.S. Degree in Automation, Mechanical, Industrial, or Electrical Engineering, with 7+ years of related experience.
Proven ability to successfully manage large and complex hardware/software automation and robotic integration projects
Advanced knowledge of PLC programming experience with any of the following: Rockwell Rockwell Allen Bradley, Automation Direct, Siemens, or equivalent.
Knowledge of vision inspection systems, preferably, Keyence or Cognex
Proficient in Solidworks
Fanuc robot programming experience, or similar.
Language Skills
Ability to read, analyzes, and interprets general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Demonstrated ability to read code/machine language, write reports, business correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the general public.

Mathematical Skills
Ability to work with mathematical concepts such as probability and statistical inference, and fundamentals of plane and solid geometry and trigonometry. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.

Reasoning Ability
Ability to define problems collects data, establish facts and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract concrete variables.

Computer Skills
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have advanced knowledge and skill with PLC programming software/languages, of Microsoft Word; Microsoft Excel; Microsoft Access and Computer assisted design (CAD) proficiency.

Certificates, licenses, registrations

PHYSICAL DEMANDS, WORK ENVIRONMENT, HEALTH AND ,SAFETY

Physical Demands
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand for extended periods of time and walk and sit; requires eye-hand coordination, use hands hand movement and manual dexterity use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl, listen and speak. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up bend, reach to shoulder level and lift, carrying, pushing and/or pulling to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, and ability to adjust focus. Hearing level within normal/average range.

Work Environment
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.

Safety and Environmental
The responsibilities of the position include compliance with company and governmental safety, environmental and hazardous materials regulations and procedures. Employee will be required to wear personal safety equipment such as safety glasses, hearing protection, or proper footwear PPE in specified areas.

Participate in the development and promotion of the HSE culture
Be exemplary in terms of health, safety and the environment, in particular by :
Respecting and ensuring respect for the instructions and rules established in the field of health, safety and the environment (in particular the LISI golden rules)
Immediately correcting, whenever possible, or reporting to his or her superiors and/or the HSE department, any malfunction or risky situation in the fields of health, safety and environmental protection
Implementing preventive actions to reduce the environmental footprint and control health and safety risks
Participate, upon request, in analyses (of risks, incidents) and HSE working groups related to his/her professional scope
Be familiar with the main health and safety risks and the main environmental impacts relating to the scope of his/her work
Be familiar with the site's HSE policy and objectives
To be able to make proposals for improving working conditions and limiting environmental impact
Benefits:
Medical
Dental
Vision
401K
Vacation and Paid Sick Leave
Education Reimbursement
General Schedule: Mon-Thurs 9hr, Fri, 4hrs
Pay Scale: $98,000.00 - $148,000.00

Quantum-Systems Inc is a global leader in aerial intelligence and autonomous, AI-powered aerial robotics. Our business directly addresses the Defense and Security markets in North America, Asia Pacific and Latin America. As a Software Engineer at Quantum-Systems you will play a critical role in solving challenges within the dynamic and competitive government UAS industry. In this role, you will be a creative problem solver, tackling the multi-faceted problems facing our various platforms and delivering cutting edge technology transforming the battlespace. Candidates will exemplify their technical acumen to identify, create and advance new technologies aligned to our company's vision for UAS and Airborne Artificial Intelligence. From envisioning future warfighter needs to executing advanced platform technologies you will be at the forefront of Aerial Intelligence.

Capable of working both independently and in a team environment

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Demonstrated ability to integrate and test complex systems including Datalinks, Control systems and vehicles
Success in a startup environment demonstrating adaptability
Experience with Unmanned Aircraft development experience a plus

Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and/or accomplishing them simultaneously
Ability to comprehend and analyze complex problems and develop solutions

The Northrop Grumman Mission Systems Sector is a trusted provider of mission-enabling solutions for global security. Our team is chartered with providing the skills, innovative technologies to develop, design, produce and sustain optimized product lines across the sector while providing a decisive advantage to the warfighter.
We are looking for a highly motivated candidate that enjoys learning and solving problems. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work on complex electronic warfare systems alongside a multi-disciplinary team. We are looking for an individual that is passionate, driven, a self-starter, and goal oriented.
The Joint Electronic Attack Compatibility Office (JEACO) of the Naval Air Warfare Center, Weapons Division (NAWC-WD), Pt. Mugu CA has an opening for a Principal/Sr. PrincipSoftware Engineer. The software engineering work is for the Intrepid Tiger II (IT II) Family of Systems (FoS) Electronic Warfare (EW) pods that currently addresses communication threats. The JEACO IT II FoS systems provide adaptable, distributed, and networked electronic warfare capability for fixed wing and rotary wing USMC aircraft. A new IT II FoS variant is in development that will address radar threats.
This position is contingent upon customer approval
This position can be filled at either the Principal or Sr. Principal level:
Basic Qualifications for Principal Software Engineer:
Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM related discipline and a minimum of 5 years of relevant software design and development experience or a Master’s degree in a STEM related discipline and a minimum of 3 years of relevant software design and development or a PhD in a STEM related discipline or in lieu of a degree, an additional 4 years of experience is required.
Java programming experience
Working knowledge of web services development utilizing LINUX, Java, XML, XSD, and DDS
Must have experience with formal software life cycle development methodologies, requirements through test.
Must be a U.S. citizen and have interim secret clearance prior to starting. Once started, must have the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. Secret Clearance.
Basic Qualifications for Sr. Principal Engineer Software Engineer:
Bachelor’s Degree in a STEM related discipline and a minimum of 8 years of relevant software design and development experience or a Master’s degree in a STEM related discipline and a minimum of 6 years of relevant software design and development or a PhD in a STEM related discipline and a minimum of 3 years of relevant software design and development experience or in lieu of a degree, an additional 4 years of experience is required.
Java programming experience
Working knowledge of web services development utilizing LINUX, Java, XML, XSD, and DDS
Must have experience with formal software life cycle development methodologies, requirements through test.
Must be a U.S. citizen and have interim secret clearance prior to starting. Once started, must have the ability to obtain and maintain a U.S. Secret Clearance.

Preferred Qualifications:
U.S. Secret or higher clearance
Experience with the Agile development methodology
Experience with Atlassian tool set (Jira, Confluence)
Experience with GitLab tool
Experience with open architecture standards and concepts
Experience with Electronic Attack (EA), Electronic Warfare Support (ES), and Direction Finding
Experience troubleshooting at the system level (hardware and software)
Communication equipment experience
Radar equipment experience
Experience with signal generators, spectrum analyzers, and network analyzers
Candidate must have excellent communication skills and be able to work in a self-directed manner.

Quantum-Systems Inc is a global leader in aerial intelligence and autonomous, AI-powered aerial robotics. We design, develop, manufacture and deliver eVTOL Unmanned Aircraft Systems (UAS) and an ecosystem of related products and services. Our business directly addresses the Defense and Security markets in North America, Asia Pacific and Latin America. As a Software Engineer at Quantum-Systems you will play a critical role in solving challenges within the dynamic and competitive government UAS industry. In this role, you will be a creative problem solver, tackling the multi-faceted problems facing our various platforms and delivering cutting edge technology transforming the battlespace. Candidates will exemplify their technical acumen to identify, create and advance new technologies aligned to our company's vision for UAS and Airborne Artificial Intelligence. From envisioning future warfighter needs to executing advanced platform technologies you will be at the forefront of Aerial Intelligence.

Collaborate as part of the Quantum-Systems engineering team
Able to lead team of to deliver project milestones in a high tempo work environment
Minimal Supervision to implement high level software architectures
Resolve complex problems during troubleshooting using industry best practices
Integrate unmanned system technologies such as edge computed data fusion, vision AI, teaming and payload coordination
Lead technical software integration efforts
Decompose the scope of an assigned project, develop corresponding software architectures and software design
Develop and Execute Software Integration and Test Plans
Lead subsystem and low-level technical reviews
Position requires travel up to 10% of the time to support business needs
Embody, promote, and live the Quantum Systems core principles
Experience:
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor of Science (BS) in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline and 2-7 years of Embedded Software experience; OR Ph.D in a STEM discipline and 2+ years of Embedded Software experience,
U.S Citizenship.
2+ years Experience in Embedded Linux design
Capable of working both independently and in a team environment
Experience in Video and Data Communications across Ethernet
Demonstrated experience in embedded C++, C#
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
This is an Onsite position
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years of machine learning development

Sr. Software Developer – Job Description
The Sr. Software Developer will be instrumental in advancing and fine-tuning our Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and 10.x. enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. In this vital role within our dynamic team, you'll engage with every phase of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), focusing on advancing and broadening the functionality of IEM's Infor SyteLine implementation. This position goes beyond mere system maintenance—it's about creating innovative solutions and new features, predominantly through SQL-based customizations in Infor SyteLine. You'll have the chance to interact with a diverse range of technologies, which will enrich your experience and skillset significantly. Additionally, you'll enjoy a collaborative atmosphere, working alongside experienced professionals dedicated to fostering your technical growth through ongoing learning and mentorship opportunities.
Responsibilities
Engage fully in all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), including design, implementation, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance of systems.
Actively gather, analyze, and document technical business requirements to drive the development and enhancement of new and existing software functionalities.
Develop and refine enhancements, add-ons, and reports specifically for Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and v10.x.
Maintain, support, and upgrade systems and applications, ensuring reliable performance and implementing necessary fixes.
Collaborate with team members to conceptualize, design, and implement project solutions effectively.
Conduct thorough testing of modifications and meticulously document programming activities and procedures.
Provide exceptional support and assistance to end-users, enhancing user satisfaction and system usability.
Design and document code conversions comprehensively, ensuring clarity and maintainability of code.
Work closely with technical colleagues to produce high-quality code in VB.NET and C#, adhering to best practices in software development.
Design, develop, and update business reports using SQL, SSRS, and Infor Reporting tools.
Offer technical support and training to peers, enhancing team knowledge and capabilities.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, ensuring minimal disruption during system conversions.
Utilize the Microsoft 365 suite proficiently (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams) to support business processes and team collaboration.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Required Expertise:
Demonstrated expertise with Infor SyteLine, with a minimum of five years of experience supporting end-users on Infor SyteLine based solutions.
Experience with upgrades from previous versions of Infor SyteLine to Infor SyteLine v10.x
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience strongly preferred.
Desired Technical Skills:
Strong in SQL, including stored procedures, views, triggers, and database management using MS T-SQL.
Knowledgeable with MS.NET Framework, Visual Studio and C#.
Ability to design and implement databases and SQL based software solutions.
Experience with version control platforms such as GitHub or SVN.
Experience with complex multi-site and multi-currency configurations.
Experience with MRP, APS and Scheduling is a plus.
Familiarity with Lake Companies Doc-Trak, Nutech Viewpoint, and Seagull Scientific Bartender is a plus.
General Competencies:
Basic understanding of manufacturing and accounting principles.
Ability to meticulously test, document, and write code changes and modifications with the end-user in mind.
Experience with helpdesk and ticketing systems is desirable.
Communication and Analytical Skills:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, capable of gathering technical requirements and translating technical details into clear, user-friendly instructions for end-users.
Must be detail-oriented with strong analytical and critical thinking skills, able to meet deadlines consistently.

Additionally, you'll enjoy a collaborative atmosphere, working alongside experienced professionals dedicated to fostering your technical growth through ongoing learning and mentorship opportunities.
Responsibilities
Engage fully in all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), including design, implementation, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance of systems.
Actively gather, analyze, and document technical business requirements to drive the development and enhancement of new and existing software functionalities.
Develop and refine enhancements, add-ons, and reports specifically for Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and v10.x.
Maintain, support, and upgrade systems and applications, ensuring reliable performance and implementing necessary fixes.
Collaborate with team members to conceptualize, design, and implement project solutions effectively.
Conduct thorough testing of modifications and meticulously document programming activities and procedures.
Provide exceptional support and assistance to end-users, enhancing user satisfaction and system usability.
Design and document code conversions comprehensively, ensuring clarity and maintainability of code.
Work closely with technical colleagues to produce high-quality code in VB.NET and C#, adhering to best practices in software development.
Design, develop, and update business reports using SQL, SSRS, and Infor Reporting tools.
Offer technical support and training to peers, enhancing team knowledge and capabilities.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, ensuring minimal disruption during system conversions.
Utilize the Microsoft 365 suite proficiently (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams) to support business processes and team collaboration.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Required Expertise:
Demonstrated expertise with Infor SyteLine, with a minimum of five years of experience supporting end-users on Infor SyteLine based solutions.
Experience with upgrades from previous versions of Infor SyteLine to Infor SyteLine v10.x
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience strongly preferred.
Desired Technical Skills:
Strong in SQL, including stored procedures, views, triggers, and database management using MS T-SQL.
Knowledgeable with MS.NET Framework, Visual Studio and C#.
Ability to design and implement databases and SQL based software solutions.
Experience with version control platforms such as GitHub or SVN.
Experience with complex multi-site and multi-currency configurations.
Experience with MRP, APS and Scheduling is a plus.
Familiarity with Lake Companies Doc-Trak, Nutech Viewpoint, and Seagull Scientific Bartender is a plus.
General Competencies:
Basic understanding of manufacturing and accounting principles.
Ability to meticulously test, document, and write code changes and modifications with the end-user in mind.
Experience with helpdesk and ticketing systems is desirable.
Communication and Analytical Skills:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, capable of gathering technical requirements and translating technical details into clear, user-friendly instructions for end-users.
Must be detail-oriented with strong analytical and critical thinking skills, able to meet deadlines consistently.
Work Authorization and Job Location:
Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident.
The position is fully remote with minimal travel required to IEM facilities or conferences.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Vision insurance
Work Location: In person

HireArt is helping an on-demand, autonomous ride-hailing company hire an experienced Android Engineer, AOSP to join the Software Engineering team driving custom in-vehicle infotainment device solutions.

In this role, you will be working with a very seasoned AOSP engineer and your work will be highly visible, at the forefront of the service rollout.

We're looking for someone with a Bachelor's in Computer Science or related degree. You have a minimum of 8 years of relevant experience. In addition, you are proficient in programming languages used in AOSP (C++/C or Java), notable experience with Android Board Support Package (BSP), Android Middleware and embedded systems development.

As an Android Engineer, AOSP, you'll:
Develop and customize Linux based Android Services, embedded services and Android applications to ensure compatibility with a range of Android versions and devices.
Design and optimize Android systems at the framework layer of AOSP to enhance performance and stability.
You will be expected to implement current best practices in embedded AOSP development, HAL customization, Android Middleware, its maintenance and security.
Work with cross-functional teams to bring up Android Software on the new devices, productionize and own the process required for maintaining company products.
Collaborate with application, hardware, infrastructure and vehicle teams on identifying and solving systems integration issues.
Bachelor's/Master's in Computer Science or similar degree with 8+ years of relevant experience
Proficiency in programming languages used in AOSP (C++/C or Java)
Strong background in AOSP development with notable experience with Android Board Support Package (BSP), Android Middleware and embedded systems development
Experience in debugging Android Native Crashes and system crashes and Experience with debugging Android Middleware (Drivers, HAL, Libraries, Framework)
Deep understanding of Android OTA mechanisms and implementing the best practices to support it across various devices
Good working knowledge of writing, modifying and maintaining Linux services under SELinux
Experience including and interfacing with external components defined and maintained by other teams/entities
Dynamic, driven and hands-on, yet capable to multitask across functions
Good working knowledge with embedded systems testing, enhancing the automated test framework is a plus
Experience with creation of Android device builds to support Android system development is a plus
Bonus Qualifications:
Android UI application development experience

Pre-tax commuter benefits
Employer (HireArt) Subsidized healthcare benefits
Flexible Spending Account for healthcare-related costs

401k package
