Applied Medical is a new-generation medical device company with a proven business model and commitment to innovation fueled by rapid business growth and expansion. Our company has been developing and manufacturing advanced surgical technologies for over 35 years and has earned a strong reputation for excellence in the healthcare field. Our unique business model, combined with our dedication to delivering the highest quality products, enables team members to contribute to a larger capacity than is possible in typical positions.
Position Description:
Position Overview: Are you a visionary Design Engineer? Join Applied Medical and be at the forefront of revolutionizing medical device manufacturing. As part of our Automation team, you will be at our global U.S. headquarters, pioneering cutting-edge machines, collaborating across departments, and leading the way in cost reduction, optimizing manufacturing processes. As a Design Engineer, you will play a vital role in supporting the development of automated machines or automated processes for our in-house medical device manufacturing. It's your chance to make an enduring impact on the future of healthcare.
Key Responsibilities:
Engineering Expertise: Successfully apply mechanical engineering principles, including materials, mechanics, design for manufacturing, mechanical systems, components, and their integration. The Design Engineer will have experience in computer-aided design (CAD) software, and have the ability to design, update and modify fixtures, prototypes, and automated machinery consisting of a wide variety of electro-mechanical components including sensors, safety components, pneumatics, drive systems, etc. to the technical standards.
Problem-Solving: Identify and resolve technical issues during the design and manufacturing processes. Perform experiments to determine optimal equipment parameters, and evaluate machine feasibility using return on investment calculations, machine costs, prototype testing results, and other appropriate engineering tools such as 3D computer-aided design (CAD), risk analysis, and Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA).
Communication and Collaboration: Work in multidisciplinary teams to understand and translate each stakeholder’s requirements into technical specifications, and convey complex ideas to stakeholders. Interact with and provide support for various teams to ensure the project runs smoothly.
Documentation and Technical Writing: Draft design specifications, test plans, engineering reports, maintenance manuals, manufacturing and calibration instructions, and qualification protocols. Then, review the documentation to ensure that quality standards are met with both new and existing equipment.

Performance Objectives:

Within your first 30 days:
Complete all Applied Learning foundational courses with a passing grade of 95% or above, demonstrating rapid integration into company processes.
Participate in team meetings and operations, contributing valuable insights and ideas to at least three team discussions.
Familiarize yourself with Applied Medical’s operations and select processes.
Within 60 days:
Complete at least one project milestone ahead of schedule, showcasing a deep understanding of role processes and projects.
Participate in and make contributions to a group project, demonstrating initiative and team collaboration.
Within 90 days to one year:
Develop interpersonal connections and relationships with others to effectively accomplish project objectives and deliverables.
Lead at least two moderate projects with moderate guidance or direction.
Manage a variety of projects on your own with little to no-guidance.

Machine Learning Engineer - Deep Neural Networks
Since the Mid-90's, we've been partnering with the US government & more recently commercial entities taking a unique approach to R&D and applying that toward real-world solutions. We provide extensive expertise in Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) image processing algorithm development, computer vision, modeling and analysis of radar systems & pattern recognition technologies.

We are looking to add an experienced Machine Learning Engineer to our esteemed team who can develop cutting edge Deep Learning technologies in the domains of Computer Vision, Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR), and Geospatial Exploitation. Due to the hands-on and sensitive nature of our work, our ideal candidate will have an active Top Secret DoD Security Clearance and be willing to work out of our HQ in El Segundo, CA.
Position Overview: The Machine Learning Engineer - Deep Neural Networks will develop, train, and deploy machine learning algorithms and neural networks to solve challenging real-world problems. Excellent debugging and problem solving skills
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills

IEM is the largest independent full-line manufacturer of electrical distribution and control systems in North America. The Company has developed one of the most sophisticated electrical product manufacturing systems in the world and has cultivated partnerships with leading component suppliers resulting in optimal solutions to customer problems. IEM has offices in California, Florida, Canada and Belgium.
Sr. Software Developer – Job Description
The Sr. Software Developer will be instrumental in advancing and fine-tuning our Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and 10.x. enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. In this vital role within our dynamic team, you'll engage with every phase of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), focusing on advancing and broadening the functionality of IEM's Infor SyteLine implementation. This position goes beyond mere system maintenance—it's about creating innovative solutions and new features, predominantly through SQL-based customizations in Infor SyteLine. You'll have the chance to interact with a diverse range of technologies, which will enrich your experience and skillset significantly. Additionally, you'll enjoy a collaborative atmosphere, working alongside experienced professionals dedicated to fostering your technical growth through ongoing learning and mentorship opportunities.
Responsibilities
Engage fully in all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), including design, implementation, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance of systems.
Actively gather, analyze, and document technical business requirements to drive the development and enhancement of new and existing software functionalities.
Develop and refine enhancements, add-ons, and reports specifically for Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and v10.x.
Maintain, support, and upgrade systems and applications, ensuring reliable performance and implementing necessary fixes.
Collaborate with team members to conceptualize, design, and implement project solutions effectively.
Conduct thorough testing of modifications and meticulously document programming activities and procedures.
Provide exceptional support and assistance to end-users, enhancing user satisfaction and system usability.
Design and document code conversions comprehensively, ensuring clarity and maintainability of code.
Work closely with technical colleagues to produce high-quality code in VB.NET and C#, adhering to best practices in software development.
Design, develop, and update business reports using SQL, SSRS, and Infor Reporting tools.
Offer technical support and training to peers, enhancing team knowledge and capabilities.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, ensuring minimal disruption during system conversions.
Utilize the Microsoft 365 suite proficiently (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams) to support business processes and team collaboration.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Required Expertise:
Demonstrated expertise with Infor SyteLine, with a minimum of five years of experience supporting end-users on Infor SyteLine based solutions.
Experience with upgrades from previous versions of Infor SyteLine to Infor SyteLine v10.x
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience strongly preferred.
Desired Technical Skills:
Strong in SQL, including stored procedures, views, triggers, and database management using MS T-SQL.
Knowledgeable with MS.NET Framework, Visual Studio and C#.
Ability to design and implement databases and SQL based software solutions.
Experience with version control platforms such as GitHub or SVN.
Experience with complex multi-site and multi-currency configurations.
Experience with MRP, APS and Scheduling is a plus.
Familiarity with Lake Companies Doc-Trak, Nutech Viewpoint, and Seagull Scientific Bartender is a plus.

Introduction
ASML US, including its affiliates and subsidiaries, bring together the most creative minds in science and technology to develop lithography machines that are key to producing faster, cheaper, more energy-efficient microchips. We design, develop, integrate, market, and service these advanced machines, which enable our customers - the world’s leading chipmakers - to reduce the size and increase the functionality of their microchips, which in turn leads to smaller, more powerful consumer electronics. Our headquarters are in Veldhoven, Netherlands, and we have 18 office locations around the United States including main offices in Chandler, Arizona, San Jose and San Diego, California, Wilton, Connecticut, and Hillsboro, Oregon.

Job Mission
The EUV source team in San Diego operates in a fast-paced, uniquely innovative and challenging environment to create new-to-industry solutions with rapid productization to support an aggressive commercialization plan for the EUV technology within ASML. The Controls Department is responsible for the development and engineering of the control loops for the EUV light source system. The EUV light source system is a complex and challenging system that requires sophisticated control algorithms, real-time embedded software, high speed electronics, and precision sensors to produce stable EUV light under dynamic conditions.
We are in search of an accomplished and driven Machine Learning Engineer who has a robust understanding of Large Language Models and Generative AI. Your primary role will involve decoding and applying groundbreaking research and setting the course for the team in this thriving field. This Machine Learning Engineer is a key enabler to further develop the site’s AI competence.
Duties and Responsibilities
Performs the design, development, and implementation of complex algorithms involving controller design, system identification, signal processing and dataset analysis using Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning techniques.
Work on a wide variety of AI projects, such as physics based model development, machine learning, Gen-AI, for the development of the EUV source, and partner with engineering teams to integrate ML models and solutions, ensuring performance optimization and alignment with broader Product goals.
Leading the exploration and application of Large Language Models and Generative AI, venturing into new areas within these fields.
Actively engaging in all aspects of model development, from ideation and experimentation to deployment.
Work with large-scale data sets and intensive hand-on algorithm development
Develop and implement complex algorithms for controller design, system identification, signal processing and dataset analysis using AI and ML techniques.
Apply scientific and mathematical control design principles and concepts to potential inventions and products, using ML techniques and tools. Conduct laboratory research on algorithm design and validation, as well as ML model development and evaluation.
Set the team's strategic direction, foster an environment that promotes innovation and professional growth.
Other duties as assigned.
Automation/Algorithms/Controls Specific
Works from broadly defined systems specifications to determine appropriate top-down automation, control system and algorithm architecture.
Generates software and /or firmware requirements for control algorithm implementations
Plans and executes laboratory research pertaining to algorithm design and validation in lab test bench and/or cleanroom
Designs and builds tools that allow debugging, analysis and performance evaluation of algorithms
Mentors more junior level algorithm engineers through technical guidance and assistance.
Skills
Experience with optimization, approximation algorithms, deep learning, and hands-on implementation of these techniques.
Ability to translate, statistically analyze large amounts of data and effectively report problems through written and/or graphical formats.
Comprehensive knowledge and hands-on experience with fine-tuning approaches and training models.
Proven problem-solving and leadership abilities, with the capacity to steer the team's research and practical applications in a collaborative and fast-paced environment.
Experienced in one or more of the following ML areas: Computer Vision, NLP, GenAi, AR/VR, Document Intelligence, or similar areas.
In-depth experience in Machine Learning, with a particular emphasis on Large Language Models (LLMs) and Generative AI.
Experience with deep learning framework such as Pytorch, TensorFlow and Keras.
Published research in the field of Machine Learning or AI is highly desirable.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
Education and Experience
An advanced degree (Master's or Ph.D.) in Computer Science, Machine Learning, Physics, Engineering or a related field
10+ years’ experience overall. Must have a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar role.
Experience in the semiconductor industry a plus.
Ongoing professional development in Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence domains is expected.
Other Information
This position is located on-site in San Diego, CA. It works on a hybrid schedule, 3 days onsite, 2 days remote. It requires onsite presence to attend in-person work-related events, trainings and meetings and to further ensure teamwork, collaboration and innovation.
Routinely required to sit; walk; talk; hear; use hands to keyboard, finger, handle, and feel; stoop, kneel, crouch, twist, reach, and stretch. Occasionally required to move around the campus.
Occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.
Must be willing to work in a clean room environment, wearing coveralls, hoods, booties, safety glasses and gloves for entire duration of shift.

Applied Medical is a new-generation medical device company with a proven business model and commitment to innovation fueled by rapid business growth and expansion. Our company has been developing and manufacturing advanced surgical technologies for over 35 years and has earned a strong reputation for excellence in the healthcare field. Our unique business model, combined with our dedication to delivering the highest quality products, enables team members to contribute to a larger capacity than is possible in typical positions.
Position Description:
Position Overview: Are you a visionary Design Engineer? Join Applied Medical and be at the forefront of revolutionizing medical device manufacturing. As part of our Automation team, you will be at our global U.S. headquarters, pioneering cutting-edge machines, collaborating across departments, and leading the way in cost reduction, optimizing manufacturing processes. As a Design Engineer, you will play a vital role in supporting the development of automated machines or automated processes for our in-house medical device manufacturing. It's your chance to make an enduring impact on the future of healthcare.
Key Responsibilities:
Engineering Expertise: Successfully apply mechanical engineering principles, including materials, mechanics, design for manufacturing, mechanical systems, components, and their integration. The Design Engineer will have experience in computer-aided design (CAD) software, and have the ability to design, update and modify fixtures, prototypes, and automated machinery consisting of a wide variety of electro-mechanical components including sensors, safety components, pneumatics, drive systems, etc. to the technical standards.
Problem-Solving: Identify and resolve technical issues during the design and manufacturing processes. Perform experiments to determine optimal equipment parameters, and evaluate machine feasibility using return on investment calculations, machine costs, prototype testing results, and other appropriate engineering tools such as 3D computer-aided design (CAD), risk analysis, and Failure Mode and Effects Analysis (FMEA).
Communication and Collaboration: Work in multidisciplinary teams to understand and translate each stakeholder’s requirements into technical specifications, and convey complex ideas to stakeholders. Interact with and provide support for various teams to ensure the project runs smoothly.
Documentation and Technical Writing: Draft design specifications, test plans, engineering reports, maintenance manuals, manufacturing and calibration instructions, and qualification protocols. Then, review the documentation to ensure that quality standards are met with both new and existing equipment.

Performance Objectives:

Within your first 30 days:
Complete all Applied Learning foundational courses with a passing grade of 95% or above, demonstrating rapid integration into company processes.
Participate in team meetings and operations, contributing valuable insights and ideas to at least three team discussions.
Familiarize yourself with Applied Medical’s operations and select processes.
Within 60 days:
Complete at least one project milestone ahead of schedule, showcasing a deep understanding of role processes and projects.
Participate in and make contributions to a group project, demonstrating initiative and team collaboration.
Within 90 days to one year:
Develop interpersonal connections and relationships with others to effectively accomplish project objectives and deliverables.
Lead at least two moderate projects with moderate guidance or direction.
Manage a variety of projects on your own with little to no-guidance.
Position Requirements:
Understand and follow Applied Manufacturing’s Quality Systems (QS) per training.
Understand and comply with safety rules and Company policies.
Bachlor's degree in Mechanical Engineering or in a related field.
Experience with designing and upgrading automated equipment, working in a team environment, and working on multiple projects at once.
Knowledge of machining and assembly tools, equipment, and techniques.
Experience with a solid-molding computer-aided design (CAD) software package such as SOLIDWORKS, CATIA, or Pro/ENGINEER.
Strong communication skills.
Knowledge of mechanical, pneumatic, and electronic devices commonly used in automated equipment.
The ability to occasionally work in a clean room and lab environment.
Preferred:
Minimum one year of experience designing and testing electro-mechanical and pneumatic systems.
Experience designing industrial or manufacturing automated systems.
Experience using machining and assembly tools and techniques.
Experience with SOLIDWORKS, Product Data Management (PDM), Systems, Applications, and Products in Data Processing (SAP), and Product Lifecycle Management (PLM).
Ability to work directly with vendors to specify, source and integrate machine components.
Experience with getting project definition from customers and meeting their needs.
Working knowledge of industrial pneumatics and sensors.
A strong analytical ability capable of understanding complex systems with multiple variables.
Understanding of Geometric Dimensioning and Tolerancing (GD&T), tolerance stack up, and manufacturing processes for precision machined parts.

If you are excited about making a significant impact, driving innovation, and contributing to a dynamic team, we encourage you to apply and embark on an exciting journey of engineering excellence at Applied Medical. Our unique business model empowers our team members to have a substantial impact, unlike conventional roles.
Benefits:
Competitive compensation range: $75000 - $100000 / year (California).
Comprehensive benefits package.
Training and mentorship opportunities.
On-campus wellness activities.
Education reimbursement program.
401(k) program with discretionary employer match.
Generous vacation accrual and paid holiday schedule.
Please note that the compensation range may be adjusted in the future, and bonus and incentive compensation plans may apply.
Our total reward package reflects our commitment to employee growth and well-being, as we invest in your development and offer a range of benefits designed to enhance your career and life.

Job Title: Principal Software Engineer, ADAS Compute Platform
Job details:
Job Description
If you are a Principal S oftware E ngineer with a passion for creating high-performance, fault-tolerant systems and have experience in leading complex software projects, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the future of automated driving technology!
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Principal Software Engineer to lead the design and development of the operating system (OS) for our autonomy subsystem, including levels L1, L2, L3, and L4. This OS encompasses a traditional OS Kernel and a critical middleware layer responsible for coordinating complex activities between various services . Your role will involve designing and implementing high-performance, reliable, and fault-tolerant systems essential for automated driving.
Key Responsibilities:
Architectural Leadership: Design and oversee the development of the middleware layer that integrates with the OS and AI/ML applications. Focus on high performance, reliability, and fault tolerance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Engage with key stakeholders including Automated Driving teams, Safety team, Systems Engineering, and the Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) team to ensure cohesive and effective system integration.
Innovation and Strategy: Drive innovation in new methods and initiatives, especially in areas with undefined procedures. Develop and communicate strategic visions specific to your responsibilities.
Prototype Development: Build prototypes and contribute to the implementation phase as needed. Leverage modern software engineering practices to ensure robust and scalable solutions.
Mentorship and Guidance: Provide technical leadership and mentorship to engineering teams. Help remove roadblocks and resolve potential issues to maintain project momentum.
Technical Influence: Shape the technical strategies and approaches of partner teams to align with overall project goals.
Technical Responsibilities:
Middleware Architecture: Lead the architectural design and implementation of the middleware layer that supports interactions between the OS and AI/ML applications.
Performance and Reliability: Ensure that the systems are built for high performance, reliability, and fault tolerance, leveraging extensive experience in these areas.
Hands-On Development: Maintain strong C++ coding skills and hands-on involvement in software development. Experience in embedded development is preferred but not mandatory.
Qualifications:
Experience: Significant experience in software architecture and development, with a focus on high-performance and fault-tolerant systems. Experience in building and managing complex middleware layers is highly desirable.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in C++ is essential. Experience with embedded systems, Linux, Windows, or Mobile OS is beneficial.
Leadership: Proven ability to provide technical leadership, drive initiatives, and mentor other engineers.
Communication: Strong skills in creating and communicating strategic visions, preparing presentations, and collaborating cross-functionally.
Problem-Solving: Ability to observe , identify , and address roadblocks and issues effectively.
Additional Information:
Flexibility: Open to candidates with experience in various operating systems, including Linux, Windows, or Mobile OS, in addition to embedded systems.
This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to Mountain View three times per week, at minimum.
This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to Mountain View three times per week, at minimum.

About GM
Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.
Why Join Us
We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.
Benefits Overview
The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.
Diversity Information
General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statements
GM is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. GM is committed to providing a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and advancing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, all practices and decisions relating to terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment are made without regard to an individ ual's protected characteristics. For purposes of this policy, “protected characteristics" include an individual's actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, weight, height, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.
At Northrop Grumman you will have a challenging and rewarding opportunity to be a part of our Enterprise-wide digital transformation. Through the use of Model-based Engineering, DevSecOps and Agile practices we continue to evolve how we deliver critical national defense products and capabilities for the warfighter. Our success is grounded in our ability to embrace change, move quickly and continuously drive innovation. The successful candidate will be collaborative, open, transparent, and team-oriented with a focus on team empowerment & shared responsibility, flexibility, continuous learning, and a culture of automation.
The Software team at Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is looking for you to join our team as a Sr Principal Software Engineer - Database Administrator based out of Pt Mugu, CA near our Camarillo, CA site. Come work with us near the beach with a growing diverse team!
If you are an experienced Database Administrator or have Software Development experience with the ability to design, develop and administer complex databases using tools such as SQL, WE WANT YOU!

Work as a self-starter, work with minimal direct supervision.
Work in an Agile environment.
Implements and maintains smooth operation of databases.
Conducts performance tuning of indexes and databases.
Reviews database design and integration of systems, provides backup recovery and makes recommendations regarding enhancements and/or improvements.
Formulates policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management.
Able to work collaboratively in a team environment with other highly motivated system/network administrators, software developers, and mission planners.
What We Can Offer You:
Northrop Grumman provides a comprehensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages your growth and supports the mutual success of our people and our company. Northrop Grumman benefits give you the flexibility and control to choose the benefits that make the most sense for you and your family. Your benefits will include the following:
Health Plan
Savings Plan

Additional benefits
Education Assistance
Training and Development
9/80 Schedule
This position is contingent upon customer approval
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree with 9+ years of relative experience; OR Master’s Degree with 7+ years of relative experience or in lieu of a degree, an additional 4+ years of experience is required.
Proficiency in systems and database management
The ability to design, develop, and administer complex databases using a database language such as SQL OR similar database languages to SQL.
Familiarity with database management best practices.
Experience implementing database schema architectures such as the coding and design of stored procedures, foreign keys, table relationships, etc.
Proficiency with Microsoft SQL Server and PostgreSQL
Strong verbal communication and customer service skills in a teamwork environment
US Citizenship and must have Interim Secret clearance prior to starting. Once started, must have the ability to obtain and maintain Secret clearance.

Sunshine Act
Amphastar reports payments and other transfers of value to health care providers as required by federal and state transparency laws and implementing regulations. These laws and regulations require Amphastar to provide government agencies with information such as a health care provider’s name, address and the type of payments or other value received, generally for public disclosure. Subject to further legal review and statutory or regulatory clarification, which Amphastar intends to pursue, reimbursement of recruiting expenses for licensed physicians may constitute a reportable transfer of value under the federal transparency law commonly known as the Sunshine Act. Therefore, if you are a licensed physician who incurs recruiting expenses as a result of interviewing with Amphastar that we pay or reimburse, your name, address and the amount of payments made currently will be reported to the government.

IEM is the largest independent full-line manufacturer of electrical distribution and control systems in North America. The Company has developed one of the most sophisticated electrical product manufacturing systems in the world and has cultivated partnerships with leading component suppliers resulting in optimal solutions to customer problems. IEM has offices in California, Florida, Canada and Belgium.
Sr. Software Developer – Job Description
The Sr. Software Developer will be instrumental in advancing and fine-tuning our Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and 10.x. enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. In this vital role within our dynamic team, you'll engage with every phase of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), focusing on advancing and broadening the functionality of IEM's Infor SyteLine implementation. This position goes beyond mere system maintenance—it's about creating innovative solutions and new features, predominantly through SQL-based customizations in Infor SyteLine. You'll have the chance to interact with a diverse range of technologies, which will enrich your experience and skillset significantly. Additionally, you'll enjoy a collaborative atmosphere, working alongside experienced professionals dedicated to fostering your technical growth through ongoing learning and mentorship opportunities.
Responsibilities
Engage fully in all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), including design, implementation, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance of systems.
Actively gather, analyze, and document technical business requirements to drive the development and enhancement of new and existing software functionalities.
Develop and refine enhancements, add-ons, and reports specifically for Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and v10.x.
Maintain, support, and upgrade systems and applications, ensuring reliable performance and implementing necessary fixes.
Collaborate with team members to conceptualize, design, and implement project solutions effectively.
Conduct thorough testing of modifications and meticulously document programming activities and procedures.
Provide exceptional support and assistance to end-users, enhancing user satisfaction and system usability.
Design and document code conversions comprehensively, ensuring clarity and maintainability of code.
Work closely with technical colleagues to produce high-quality code in VB.NET and C#, adhering to best practices in software development.
Design, develop, and update business reports using SQL, SSRS, and Infor Reporting tools.
Offer technical support and training to peers, enhancing team knowledge and capabilities.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, ensuring minimal disruption during system conversions.
Utilize the Microsoft 365 suite proficiently (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams) to support business processes and team collaboration.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Required Expertise:
Demonstrated expertise with Infor SyteLine, with a minimum of five years of experience supporting end-users on Infor SyteLine based solutions.
Experience with upgrades from previous versions of Infor SyteLine to Infor SyteLine v10.x
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience strongly preferred.
Desired Technical Skills:
Strong in SQL, including stored procedures, views, triggers, and database management using MS T-SQL.
Knowledgeable with MS.NET Framework, Visual Studio and C#.
Ability to design and implement databases and SQL based software solutions.
Experience with version control platforms such as GitHub or SVN.
Experience with complex multi-site and multi-currency configurations.
Experience with MRP, APS and Scheduling is a plus.
Familiarity with Lake Companies Doc-Trak, Nutech Viewpoint, and Seagull Scientific Bartender is a plus.
General Competencies:
Basic understanding of manufacturing and accounting principles.
Ability to meticulously test, document, and write code changes and modifications with the end-user in mind.
Experience with helpdesk and ticketing systems is desirable.
Communication and Analytical Skills:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, capable of gathering technical requirements and translating technical details into clear, user-friendly instructions for end-users.
Must be detail-oriented with strong analytical and critical thinking skills, able to meet deadlines consistently.
Work Authorization and Job Location:
Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident.
The position is fully remote with minimal travel required to IEM facilities or conferences.
Job Type: Full-time

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Vision insurance

Job Title: Principal Software Engineer, ADAS Compute Platform
Job details:
Job Description
If you are a Principal S oftware E ngineer with a passion for creating high-performance, fault-tolerant systems and have experience in leading complex software projects, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the future of automated driving technology!
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Principal Software Engineer to lead the design and development of the operating system (OS) for our autonomy subsystem, including levels L1, L2, L3, and L4. This OS encompasses a traditional OS Kernel and a critical middleware layer responsible for coordinating complex activities between various services . Your role will involve designing and implementing high-performance, reliable, and fault-tolerant systems essential for automated driving.
Key Responsibilities:
Architectural Leadership: Design and oversee the development of the middleware layer that integrates with the OS and AI/ML applications. Focus on high performance, reliability, and fault tolerance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Engage with key stakeholders including Automated Driving teams, Safety team, Systems Engineering, and the Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) team to ensure cohesive and effective system integration.
Innovation and Strategy: Drive innovation in new methods and initiatives, especially in areas with undefined procedures. Develop and communicate strategic visions specific to your responsibilities.
Prototype Development: Build prototypes and contribute to the implementation phase as needed. Leverage modern software engineering practices to ensure robust and scalable solutions.
Mentorship and Guidance: Provide technical leadership and mentorship to engineering teams. Help remove roadblocks and resolve potential issues to maintain project momentum.
Technical Influence: Shape the technical strategies and approaches of partner teams to align with overall project goals.
Technical Responsibilities:
Middleware Architecture: Lead the architectural design and implementation of the middleware layer that supports interactions between the OS and AI/ML applications.
Performance and Reliability: Ensure that the systems are built for high performance, reliability, and fault tolerance, leveraging extensive experience in these areas.
Hands-On Development: Maintain strong C++ coding skills and hands-on involvement in software development. Experience in embedded development is preferred but not mandatory.
Qualifications:
Experience: Significant experience in software architecture and development, with a focus on high-performance and fault-tolerant systems. Experience in building and managing complex middleware layers is highly desirable.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in C++ is essential. Experience with embedded systems, Linux, Windows, or Mobile OS is beneficial.
Leadership: Proven ability to provide technical leadership, drive initiatives, and mentor other engineers.
Communication: Strong skills in creating and communicating strategic visions, preparing presentations, and collaborating cross-functionally.
Problem-Solving: Ability to observe , identify , and address roadblocks and issues effectively.
Additional Information:
Flexibility: Open to candidates with experience in various operating systems, including Linux, Windows, or Mobile OS, in addition to embedded systems.
This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to Mountain View three times per week, at minimum.
This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to Mountain View three times per week, at minimum.

Compensation
DP World offers exciting and challenging roles within a growing international organization. We strive to hire and develop the right people, locally and globally, stimulating personal growth and self-development within an informal atmosphere. We offer a market competitive compensation package.

About DP World
Trade is the lifeblood of the global economy, creating opportunities and improving the quality of life for people around the world. DP World exists to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally.
With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 111,000 employees from 159 nationalities, spanning 77 countries on six continents, DP World is pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future.
We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades.
What's more, we're reshaping the future by investing in innovation. From intelligent delivery systems to automated warehouse stacking, we’re at the cutting edge of disruptive technology, pushing the sector towards better ways to trade, minimising disruptions from the factory floor to the customer’s door.
DP World is on a mission to transcend boundaries and bridge the gap between all nations and cultures – not just in what we do but also in how we behave.
We are dedicated to creating a culture where everyone feels respected, supported, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that embracing inclusion and diversity, drives innovation and growth and helps us connect people, businesses, and societies. Free minds and different perspectives are changing our world, and together we can change what’s possible.
The DP World family comprises of syncreon, Imperial and P&O.
WE MAKE TRADE FLOW
TO CHANGE WHAT'S POSSIBLE FOR EVERYONE.

IEM is the largest independent full-line manufacturer of electrical distribution and control systems in North America. The Company has developed one of the most sophisticated electrical product manufacturing systems in the world and has cultivated partnerships with leading component suppliers resulting in optimal solutions to customer problems. IEM has offices in California, Florida, Canada and Belgium.
Sr. Software Developer – Job Description
The Sr. Software Developer will be instrumental in advancing and fine-tuning our Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and 10.x. enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. In this vital role within our dynamic team, you'll engage with every phase of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), focusing on advancing and broadening the functionality of IEM's Infor SyteLine implementation. This position goes beyond mere system maintenance—it's about creating innovative solutions and new features, predominantly through SQL-based customizations in Infor SyteLine. You'll have the chance to interact with a diverse range of technologies, which will enrich your experience and skillset significantly. Additionally, you'll enjoy a collaborative atmosphere, working alongside experienced professionals dedicated to fostering your technical growth through ongoing learning and mentorship opportunities.
Responsibilities
Engage fully in all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), including design, implementation, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance of systems.
Actively gather, analyze, and document technical business requirements to drive the development and enhancement of new and existing software functionalities.
Develop and refine enhancements, add-ons, and reports specifically for Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and v10.x.
Maintain, support, and upgrade systems and applications, ensuring reliable performance and implementing necessary fixes.
Collaborate with team members to conceptualize, design, and implement project solutions effectively.
Conduct thorough testing of modifications and meticulously document programming activities and procedures.
Provide exceptional support and assistance to end-users, enhancing user satisfaction and system usability.
Design and document code conversions comprehensively, ensuring clarity and maintainability of code.
Work closely with technical colleagues to produce high-quality code in VB.NET and C#, adhering to best practices in software development.
Design, develop, and update business reports using SQL, SSRS, and Infor Reporting tools.
Offer technical support and training to peers, enhancing team knowledge and capabilities.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, ensuring minimal disruption during system conversions.
Utilize the Microsoft 365 suite proficiently (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams) to support business processes and team collaboration.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Required Expertise:
Demonstrated expertise with Infor SyteLine, with a minimum of five years of experience supporting end-users on Infor SyteLine based solutions.
Experience with upgrades from previous versions of Infor SyteLine to Infor SyteLine v10.x
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience strongly preferred.
Desired Technical Skills:
Strong in SQL, including stored procedures, views, triggers, and database management using MS T-SQL.
Knowledgeable with MS.NET Framework, Visual Studio and C#.
Ability to design and implement databases and SQL based software solutions.
Experience with version control platforms such as GitHub or SVN.
Experience with complex multi-site and multi-currency configurations.
Experience with MRP, APS and Scheduling is a plus.
Familiarity with Lake Companies Doc-Trak, Nutech Viewpoint, and Seagull Scientific Bartender is a plus.
General Competencies:
Basic understanding of manufacturing and accounting principles.
Ability to meticulously test, document, and write code changes and modifications with the end-user in mind.
Experience with helpdesk and ticketing systems is desirable.
Communication and Analytical Skills:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, capable of gathering technical requirements and translating technical details into clear, user-friendly instructions for end-users.
Must be detail-oriented with strong analytical and critical thinking skills, able to meet deadlines consistently.
Work Authorization and Job Location:
Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident.
The position is fully remote with minimal travel required to IEM facilities or conferences.
Job Type: Full-time

401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance

At STAr-Edge, you will be part of a skilled R&D team that designs precision testing instruments for semiconductor manufacturers all over the world. We are seeking software engineers who have the skill set to write low level C++ hardware driver code, and have the skillset to architect system frameworks in C#.
As a member of a small research team, you and everyone on the team is expected to be skilled in multiple engineering disciplines. Specific responsibilities for this position are to code instrument drivers, define system architecture, write software requirement documents, and manage small remote software teams.

BSCS or BSEE required.
3+ years of management experience with 10+ years of the overall experience

o Expertise in C++ and C#
o Low level hardware driver experience
o Experience with multi-process communication.
o Experience with real-time performance optimization
o Electrical engineering experience is a plus
o Proficiency in the Chinese language is a plus
Company Description
STAr-Edge Technologies, Inc. is headquartered in Carlsbad, CA. We design and manufacture high precision test instruments used in the manufacturing and qualification of the semiconductors. Our major customers include top tier players in the semiconductor industries such as tsmc, UMC, Global Foundries, Samsung, Toshiba, Renesas, Maxim, and OmniVision.
STAr-Edge Technologies is the USA branch of STAr Technologies, which is an international company with over 600 employees worldwide. STAr is the acronym for "Semiconductor Test Architects" - we are the architects with leading technologies for semiconductor test solutions.

At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work — and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.
At Northrop Grumman you will have a challenging and rewarding opportunity to be a part of our Enterprise-wide digital transformation. Through the use of Model-based Engineering, DevSecOps and Agile practices we continue to evolve how we deliver critical national defense products and capabilities for the warfighter. Our success is grounded in our ability to embrace change, move quickly and continuously drive innovation. The successful candidate will be collaborative, open, transparent, and team-oriented with a focus on team empowerment & shared responsibility, flexibility, continuous learning, and a culture of automation.
The Software team at Northrop Grumman Mission Systems (NGMS) is looking for you to join our team as a Sr Principal Software Engineer - Database Administrator based out of Pt Mugu, CA near our Camarillo, CA site. Come work with us near the beach with a growing diverse team!
If you are an experienced Database Administrator or have Software Development experience with the ability to design, develop and administer complex databases using tools such as SQL, WE WANT YOU!
What you will get to do:
Work as a self-starter, work with minimal direct supervision.
Work in an Agile environment.
Implements and maintains smooth operation of databases.
Conducts performance tuning of indexes and databases.
Reviews database design and integration of systems, provides backup recovery and makes recommendations regarding enhancements and/or improvements.
Formulates policies, procedures, and standards relating to database management.
Able to work collaboratively in a team environment with other highly motivated system/network administrators, software developers, and mission planners.
What We Can Offer You:
Northrop Grumman provides a comprehensive benefits package and a work environment that encourages your growth and supports the mutual success of our people and our company. Northrop Grumman benefits give you the flexibility and control to choose the benefits that make the most sense for you and your family. Your benefits will include the following:
Health Plan
Savings Plan
Paid Time Off
Additional benefits
Education Assistance
Training and Development
9/80 Schedule
This position is contingent upon customer approval
Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree with 9+ years of relative experience; OR Master’s Degree with 7+ years of relative experience or in lieu of a degree, an additional 4+ years of experience is required.
Proficiency in systems and database management
The ability to design, develop, and administer complex databases using a database language such as SQL OR similar database languages to SQL.
Familiarity with database management best practices.
Experience implementing database schema architectures such as the coding and design of stored procedures, foreign keys, table relationships, etc.
Proficiency with Microsoft SQL Server and PostgreSQL
Strong verbal communication and customer service skills in a teamwork environment
US Citizenship and must have Interim Secret clearance prior to starting. Once started, must have the ability to obtain and maintain Secret clearance.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience working in a containerized environment with Docker, Kubernetes, etc.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to communicate within the NGC various sites as well as with customers.
Experience with high level coding languages such as C#, C++, PowerShell, VBA, etc.
Experience with Azure DevOps / TFS and Git
Salary Range: $133,000 - $199,600

Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.

Job Title: Principal Software Engineer, ADAS Compute Platform
Job details:
Job Description
If you are a Principal S oftware E ngineer with a passion for creating high-performance, fault-tolerant systems and have experience in leading complex software projects, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity. Join us in shaping the future of automated driving technology!
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Principal Software Engineer to lead the design and development of the operating system (OS) for our autonomy subsystem, including levels L1, L2, L3, and L4. This OS encompasses a traditional OS Kernel and a critical middleware layer responsible for coordinating complex activities between various services . Your role will involve designing and implementing high-performance, reliable, and fault-tolerant systems essential for automated driving.
Key Responsibilities:
Architectural Leadership: Design and oversee the development of the middleware layer that integrates with the OS and AI/ML applications. Focus on high performance, reliability, and fault tolerance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Engage with key stakeholders including Automated Driving teams, Safety team, Systems Engineering, and the Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) team to ensure cohesive and effective system integration.
Innovation and Strategy: Drive innovation in new methods and initiatives, especially in areas with undefined procedures. Develop and communicate strategic visions specific to your responsibilities.
Prototype Development: Build prototypes and contribute to the implementation phase as needed. Leverage modern software engineering practices to ensure robust and scalable solutions.
Mentorship and Guidance: Provide technical leadership and mentorship to engineering teams. Help remove roadblocks and resolve potential issues to maintain project momentum.
Technical Influence: Shape the technical strategies and approaches of partner teams to align with overall project goals.
Technical Responsibilities:
Middleware Architecture: Lead the architectural design and implementation of the middleware layer that supports interactions between the OS and AI/ML applications.
Performance and Reliability: Ensure that the systems are built for high performance, reliability, and fault tolerance, leveraging extensive experience in these areas.
Hands-On Development: Maintain strong C++ coding skills and hands-on involvement in software development. Experience in embedded development is preferred but not mandatory.
Qualifications:
Experience: Significant experience in software architecture and development, with a focus on high-performance and fault-tolerant systems. Experience in building and managing complex middleware layers is highly desirable.
Technical Skills: Proficiency in C++ is essential. Experience with embedded systems, Linux, Windows, or Mobile OS is beneficial.
Leadership: Proven ability to provide technical leadership, drive initiatives, and mentor other engineers.
Communication: Strong skills in creating and communicating strategic visions, preparing presentations, and collaborating cross-functionally.
Problem-Solving: Ability to observe , identify , and address roadblocks and issues effectively.
Additional Information:
Flexibility: Open to candidates with experience in various operating systems, including Linux, Windows, or Mobile OS, in addition to embedded systems.
This role is categorized as hybrid. This means the successful candidate is expected to report to Mountain View three times per week, at minimum.

About GM
Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.
Why Join Us
We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day – individually and collectively – to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.
Benefits Overview
The goal of the General Motors total rewards program is to support the health and well-being of you and your family. Our comprehensive compensation plan incudes, the following benefits, in addition to many others:
Paid time off including vacation days, holidays, and parental leave for mothers, fathers and adoptive parents;
Healthcare (including a triple tax advantaged health savings account and wellness incentive), dental, vision and life insurance plans to cover you and your family;
Company and matching contributions to 401K savings plan to help you save for retirement;
Global recognition program for peers and leaders to recognize and be recognized for results and behaviors that reflect our company values;
Tuition assistance and student loan refinancing;
Discount on GM vehicles for you, your family and friends.
Diversity Information
General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteer opportunities. GM is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.
Equal Employment Opportunity Statements
GM is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. GM is committed to providing a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and advancing equal employment opportunities for all qualified individuals. As part of this commitment, all practices and decisions relating to terms and conditions of employment, including, but not limited to, recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, discipline, compensation, benefits, and termination of employment are made without regard to an individ ual's protected characteristics. For purposes of this policy, “protected characteristics" include an individual's actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), gender identity or gender expression, sexual orientation, weight, height, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, protected medical condition as defined by applicable state or local law, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, email us at Careers.Accommodations@GM.com or call us at 800-865-7580. In your email, please include a description of the specific accommodation you are requesting as well as the job title and requisition number of the position for which you are applying.

Join our team to work in an embedded technology environment to develop software working with real time operating systems for use in flight and mission critical systems. We build complex aircraft systems using the latest technologies including simulation, cloud computing, DevSecOps, and cyber that can rapidly evolve to deliver enhanced capabilities for fielded systems, modernizing in partnership with our customers to meet their most complex missions. Bring your innovative ideas and ingenuity, to help us define possible and have some fun along the way.

Northrop Grumman Aeronautics Systems has an opening for a Sr Principal Simulation Software Engineer to join our team of qualified, diverse individuals within our Software organization in Palmdale, California, where we define possible.

Accomplish
In this role you will design, develop, integrate and test software for our end-user customers and businesses. Specifically, you will be responsible for the design, architecture, application development, and flight simulation. You will work with multi-disciplinary teams, such as with Systems Engineering, Cloud & Application, Test Automation, DevSecOps and Systems Test, in an Agile software development environment. Our simulation software is critical to the current and future company projects. You will analyze system capabilities to resolve problems on program intent, output requirements, input data acquisition, programming techniques and controls.
Essential Functions:
Work in an innovative environment, on significantly diverse assignments, and in collaborative team settings across all levels
Participate in the full software development life cycle including requirements, design, implementation, qualification, and delivery of software products to our customers
Architect and develop applications in a simulated training environment
Be a part of Agile Scrum teams to develop software products for multiple software baselines
Succeed
The individual we seek will be self-motivated, proactive, goal-oriented to help us grow our services, become even better at what we do and will possess the following qualifications.

Basic Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in a STEM discipline (Science, Technology, Engineering or Math) with 9 years of related engineering experience; OR a Master’s degree in STEM with 7 years of related engineering experience
Experience with the full Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) - software design requirements, application development, integration, testing, and deployment
Experience with at least one of the following programming or scripting languages: C, C++, and Python
Experience with two or more of the following tools: Jira, Crucible, Bitbucket, Subversion, Bamboo, Jenkins, Sonarqube, Fortify, or Coverity
Must have an active DoD Secret or higher clearance.
Must have the ability to obtain and maintain Special Access Program (SAP) clearance prior to the commencement of employment.
Preferred Qualifications:
Strong understanding of C and C++ languages including templates, memory storage, and compiler/linker
Experience with or knowledge of Joint Simulation Environment (JSE), Distributed Interactive Simulation (DIS), or High-Level Architecture (HLA)
Experience with Full-Motion Flight Training Systems
Experience with simulated threat environments such as AFSIM or NGTS
Ability to collaborate with systems engineers, hardware designers and integration/test engineers to develop and maintain complex software systems
Excellent communication, interpersonal skills, and the ability to interface with all levels of employees and management

Thrive with Us
At Northrop Grumman we are invested in the growth and well-being off all our employees. We offer flexible work arrangements, phenomenal learning opportunities, exposure to a wide variety of projects and customers, and a very friendly team environment.

Our Total Rewards Program offers a comprehensive employee benefits package, including a Retirement and Savings Plan, group medical, dental and vision coverage, life and disability insurance, and flexible spending accounts.

We have a new Academy which is a onboarding and professional development / employee engagement tool we’ve designed to support employees and their teams. A newsletter is sent out each month to keep the division apprised of upcoming events. There are three areas of focus: Mission Education, Leadership Excellence, and Program Orientation.

We have Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that provide benefits for the member, our leaders and the company. Our ERGs offer opportunities to be a friend, be active, be a volunteer, be a leader, to be recognized and to be yourself. Every ERG is inclusive of all employees!
If you are ready to join us in defining possible, apply now.

Quantum-Systems Inc is a global leader in aerial intelligence and autonomous, AI-powered aerial robotics. As a Software Engineer at Quantum-Systems you will play a critical role in solving challenges within the dynamic and competitive government UAS industry. In this role, you will be a creative problem solver, tackling the multi-faceted problems facing our various platforms and delivering cutting edge technology transforming the battlespace. From envisioning future warfighter needs to executing advanced platform technologies you will be at the forefront of Aerial Intelligence.

Collaborate as part of the Quantum-Systems engineering team

Minimal Supervision to implement high level software architectures

Integrate unmanned system technologies such as edge computed data fusion, vision AI, teaming and payload coordination
Lead technical software integration efforts
Decompose the scope of an assigned project, develop corresponding software architectures and software design
Develop and Execute Software Integration and Test Plans
Lead subsystem and low-level technical reviews
Position requires travel up to 10% of the time to support business needs
Embody, promote, and live the Quantum Systems core principles
Experience:

Bachelor of Science (BS) in a Science, Technology, Engineering or Mathematics (STEM) discipline and 2-7 years of Embedded Software experience; OR Ph.D in a STEM discipline and 2+ years of Embedded Software experience,
U.S Citizenship.
2+ years Experience in Embedded Linux design
Capable of working both independently and in a team environment
Experience in Video and Data Communications across Ethernet
Demonstrated experience in embedded C++, C#
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
This is an Onsite position
Preferred Qualifications:
2+ years of machine learning development
Demonstrated Experience in Windows WPF development
Embedded communication networks using UDP streams and sockets
Demonstrated ability to integrate and test complex systems including Datalinks, Control systems and vehicles
Success in a startup environment demonstrating adaptability
Experience with Unmanned Aircraft development experience a plus
Ability to prioritize and adjust tasks to accomplish desired results
Ability to prioritize multiple responsibilities and/or accomplishing them simultaneously
Ability to comprehend and analyze complex problems and develop solutions
Background Check/U.S. Citizenship required

IEM is the largest independent full-line manufacturer of electrical distribution and control systems in North America. The Company has developed one of the most sophisticated electrical product manufacturing systems in the world and has cultivated partnerships with leading component suppliers resulting in optimal solutions to customer problems. IEM has offices in California, Florida, Canada and Belgium.
Sr. Software Developer – Job Description
The Sr. Software Developer will be instrumental in advancing and fine-tuning our Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and 10.x. enterprise resource planning (ERP) system. In this vital role within our dynamic team, you'll engage with every phase of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), focusing on advancing and broadening the functionality of IEM's Infor SyteLine implementation. This position goes beyond mere system maintenance—it's about creating innovative solutions and new features, predominantly through SQL-based customizations in Infor SyteLine. You'll have the chance to interact with a diverse range of technologies, which will enrich your experience and skillset significantly. Additionally, you'll enjoy a collaborative atmosphere, working alongside experienced professionals dedicated to fostering your technical growth through ongoing learning and mentorship opportunities.
Responsibilities
Engage fully in all phases of the Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC), including design, implementation, coding, testing, deployment, and maintenance of systems.
Actively gather, analyze, and document technical business requirements to drive the development and enhancement of new and existing software functionalities.
Develop and refine enhancements, add-ons, and reports specifically for Infor SyteLine versions 9.00.30 and v10.x.
Maintain, support, and upgrade systems and applications, ensuring reliable performance and implementing necessary fixes.
Collaborate with team members to conceptualize, design, and implement project solutions effectively.
Conduct thorough testing of modifications and meticulously document programming activities and procedures.
Provide exceptional support and assistance to end-users, enhancing user satisfaction and system usability.
Design and document code conversions comprehensively, ensuring clarity and maintainability of code.
Work closely with technical colleagues to produce high-quality code in VB.NET and C#, adhering to best practices in software development.
Design, develop, and update business reports using SQL, SSRS, and Infor Reporting tools.
Offer technical support and training to peers, enhancing team knowledge and capabilities.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, ensuring minimal disruption during system conversions.
Utilize the Microsoft 365 suite proficiently (Word, Excel, Outlook, and Teams) to support business processes and team collaboration.
Other duties as assigned.
Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities
Required Expertise:
Demonstrated expertise with Infor SyteLine, with a minimum of five years of experience supporting end-users on Infor SyteLine based solutions.
Experience with upgrades from previous versions of Infor SyteLine to Infor SyteLine v10.x
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience strongly preferred.
Desired Technical Skills:
Strong in SQL, including stored procedures, views, triggers, and database management using MS T-SQL.
Knowledgeable with MS.NET Framework, Visual Studio and C#.
Ability to design and implement databases and SQL based software solutions.
Experience with version control platforms such as GitHub or SVN.
Experience with complex multi-site and multi-currency configurations.
Experience with MRP, APS and Scheduling is a plus.
Familiarity with Lake Companies Doc-Trak, Nutech Viewpoint, and Seagull Scientific Bartender is a plus.
General Competencies:
Basic understanding of manufacturing and accounting principles.
Ability to meticulously test, document, and write code changes and modifications with the end-user in mind.
Experience with helpdesk and ticketing systems is desirable.
Communication and Analytical Skills:
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills, capable of gathering technical requirements and translating technical details into clear, user-friendly instructions for end-users.
Must be detail-oriented with strong analytical and critical thinking skills, able to meet deadlines consistently.
Work Authorization and Job Location:
Must be a U.S. Citizen or Permanent Resident.
The position is fully remote with minimal travel required to IEM facilities or conferences.
Job Type: Full-time
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Vision insurance
Work Location: In person

About DP World
Trade is the lifeblood of the global economy, creating opportunities and improving the quality of life for people around the world. DP World exists to make the world’s trade flow better, changing what’s possible for the customers and communities we serve globally.
With a dedicated, diverse and professional team of more than 111,000 employees from 159 nationalities, spanning 77 countries on six continents, DP World is pushing trade further and faster towards a seamless supply chain that’s fit for the future.
We’re rapidly transforming and integrating our businesses - Ports and Terminals, Marine Services, Logistics and Technology – and uniting our global infrastructure with local expertise to create stronger, more efficient end-to-end supply chain solutions that can change the way the world trades.
What's more, we're reshaping the future by investing in innovation. From intelligent delivery systems to automated warehouse stacking, we’re at the cutting edge of disruptive technology, pushing the sector towards better ways to trade, minimising disruptions from the factory floor to the customer’s door.
DP World is on a mission to transcend boundaries and bridge the gap between all nations and cultures – not just in what we do but also in how we behave.
We are dedicated to creating a culture where everyone feels respected, supported, and empowered to reach their full potential. We believe that embracing inclusion and diversity, drives innovation and growth and helps us connect people, businesses, and societies. Free minds and different perspectives are changing our world, and together we can change what’s possible.
The DP World family comprises of syncreon, Imperial and P&O.

Position Description
As a Flight Software Engineer, you will be working with a leading satellite and spacecraft component manufacturing company with an opportunity to work on a variety of space based programs.

Your future duties and responsibilities
CGI is looking for experienced Flight Software Engineers, across a number of experience levels, to develop embedded software. Selected candidates will work with manual sequencer, momentum error computation, control laws, global estimator, AWS Kernels, layer 3 Network architecture and a variety of additional technologies (proficiency not required across all areas). You would be expected to be proficient in C/C++ and Ada. It is desirable that the candidate have experience with embedded development using a real-time operating system. Candidates must be open to building and executing a robust testing schema throughout a project's lifecycle.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role
Candidates applying to this position should have a Bachelor's degree, or greater, in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science or an equivalent field with significant software development experience.

It is possible that occasional travel will be required to both customer and supplier sites. It is possible that travel will be both within and outside the continental United States.

Required qualifications to be successful in this role:
Ada 95
C/C++
Embedded real-time C++ software development on embedded real-time operating system (RTOS)
Organizational skills: Ability to work with the information gathered during requirements analysis and to exercise flexibility with changing business priorities
Time Management skills: Ability to work in a fast paced team environment and consistently meet deadlines. Work independently with minimal supervision
Agile processes and practices
C++ cross-compiler to microprocessor
Debugging using telemetry, data collection & data reduction
Experience with core Flight System (cFS)
Full life-cycle development
Git - source code versioning
Guidance Navigation & Control (GNC)
Jira - issue tracking and Agile project management
